inducticius: <entryFree id="n22913" type="main" key="inducti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">introduced</hi>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Duab. Anim. 12:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Duab. Anim. 12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inductio: <entryFree id="n22914" type="main" key="inducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi> <pb n="938" /> <cb n="INDU" /> or <hi rend="ital">bringing into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introducing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admission</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22914.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos aquarum inductionibus terris fecunditatem damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (juvenum in circum),</quote> <trans><tr>introduction</tr>, <tr>exhibition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so on the stage: ficta personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima trullis frequentetur inductio,</quote> <trans><tr>a plastering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a striking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erasing</hi> of writing (cf. induco, 1. C. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">lituras, inductiones, superductiones ipse feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22914.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n22914.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An awning</hi> drawn over a theatre to protect the audience from the sun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n22914.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fomentation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:27:216" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 27, 216</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22914.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22914.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (acc. to induco II. B. 2. b.), <hi rend="ital">a purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedet profecto virtuti dolor et animi inductione languescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22914.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., rhet. t. t. </sense><sense id="n22914.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Induction</hi>, a mode of reasoning from known particulars to generals, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pagwgh/,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:2" default="NO">5, 11, 2</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">erroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22914.9" n="2" level="3"> Personarum ficta, = <foreign lang="greek">proswpopoii/+a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the introduction of a fictitious person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22914.10" n="3" level="3"> Erroris inductio, = <foreign lang="greek">a)popla/nhsis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a leading into error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misguiding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22914.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An assumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1144</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inductivus: <entryFree id="n22915" type="main" key="inducti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>induco</etym>, <sense id="n22915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to an assumption</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1144</bibl> P.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inductīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">by yielding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgere (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:157" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inductor: <entryFree id="n22916" type="main" key="inductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who stirs up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rouses</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">a chastiser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inductorium: <entryFree id="n22917" type="hapax" key="inducto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere inductorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inductorius: <entryFree id="n22918" type="main" key="inducto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">misleading</hi>, August. contr. Acad. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
inductrix: <entryFree id="n22919" type="main" key="inductrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that misleads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deceives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
inductura: <entryFree id="n22920" type="main" key="inductu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coating</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:148" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inductus: <entryFree id="n22921" type="main" key="inductus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from induco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22922" type="main" key="inductus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n22922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>) [induco], <hi rend="ital">an inducement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi> (rare but class.): hujus persuasu et inductu, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 69</bibl>: inductu alieno facere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">at another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s persuasion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inducula: <entryFree id="n22923" type="hapax" key="indu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of under-garment worn by females</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indugredior: <entryFree id="n22924" type="main" key="indugredior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indu-gredior</orth>, v. ingredior and in <sense id="n22924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indulceo: <entryFree id="n22925" type="main" key="indulceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dulceo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n22925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become very sweet</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indulcitas: <entryFree id="n22926" type="spur" key="indulci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dulcĭtas</orth>, false read. for dulcitas, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 29</bibl>; v. Com. Rel. p. 60 Rib.</entryFree>
indulco: <entryFree id="n22927" type="main" key="indulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dulco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweeten</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n22927.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam amaram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 38, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22927.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to speak sweetly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 12, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indulcoro: <entryFree id="n22928" type="main" key="indulco_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dulcōro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very sweet</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indulgens: <entryFree id="n22929" type="main" key="indulgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgens</orth> <itype>tis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indulgeo.</entryFree>
indulgenter: <entryFree id="n22930" type="main" key="indulgenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indulgeo <sense id="n22930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indulgentia: <entryFree id="n22931" type="main" key="indulgenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indulgens</etym>, <sense id="n22931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22931.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est dignius, in quo omnis nostra diligentia indulgentiaque consumatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujus (matris) sinu indulgentiaque educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a corporis obsequio indulgentiaque discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with benevolentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam sibi ducis indulgentia quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63, 8</bibl></cit>: ejus nimia indulgentia in Lepidum, Planc. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 4</bibl>: pro sua indulgentia in suos, Balb. et Opp. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui simili sensu atque indulgentia filiarum commovemini, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 112</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22931.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mild weather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:186" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 21, 50, § 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22931.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A remission</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22931.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Of punishment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 6, § 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n22931.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Of taxation, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 16</bibl>. <cb n="INDU" /></sense></entryFree>
indulgeo: <entryFree id="n22932" type="main" key="indulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgĕo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.; cf. dulcis], <hi rend="ital">to be courteous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">complaisant; to be kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgent to; to be pleased with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulge in</hi> a thing (as joy or grief); <hi rend="ital">to concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22932.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">V. n.</hi> (class.); constr. with the <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n22932.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduorum civitati Caesar praecipue indulserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sibi indulsit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>indulged himself so</tr>, <tr>took such liberties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgebat sibi liberalius, quam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgent sibi latius ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:234" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa sibi imbecillitas indulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgent consules legionum ardori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:151" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 142</bibl></cit>: animo, <hi rend="ital">to give way to passion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to anger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:598" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 598</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno,</quote> <trans><tr>to delight in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>give room to</tr>, <tr>set apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22932.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of the person (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): eri, qui nos tantopere indulgent, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 502, 11</bibl> (Fragm. Com. v. 390 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">te indulgebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: animus indulgeri potuisset, <hi rend="ital">be pleased</hi>, Gell. praef. 1.— </sense><sense id="n22932.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to give one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be given</hi> or <hi rend="ital">addicted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to indulge in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres amicitias spernere, indulgere novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil relicturus, si aviditati indulgeretur, quod in aerarium referret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sero petentibus non indulgebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:164" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22932.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">V. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow as a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi> (post- Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui usum pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta consularia procuratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatis arbitrium mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia triumphi indulsit Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam flagello,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to submit to patiently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:105:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 105, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil animis in corpora juris natura indulget,</quote> <trans><tr>grants no power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia plectro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte indulsit cura soporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam pueris,</quote> <trans><tr>to make allowance for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 168</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22932.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">incolere templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:672" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 672</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam nunc sanguinem meum sibi indulgeri aequum censet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ipsa natura in eo quod indulsisse homini videtur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abolitio reorum, quae publice indulgetur,</quote> <trans><tr>is granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22932.7" n="B" level="2"> Se alicui, <hi rend="ital">in mal. part.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:165 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 165 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n22932.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indulgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tender to</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">fond of</hi> one; constr. with <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22932.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium peccatis indulgens praecipitem amicum ferri sinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22932.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas minime in captivos indulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22932.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ipsum nomen amantius, indulgentiusque maternum, hoc illius matris singulare scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 25, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22932.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Addicted to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleae indulgens,</quote> <trans><tr>addicted to dicing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22932.13" n="C" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondly loved</hi>: fili, indulgentissime adulescens, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 13</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indulgently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis indulgenter loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae multa faciunt indulgenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 109</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii alios indulgentius tractant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indulgitas: <entryFree id="n22933" type="main" key="indulgi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indulgĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n22933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, for indulgentia (ante-class.): indulgitate victus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 9</bibl>: indulgitate liberum, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 345</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indultor: <entryFree id="n22934" type="main" key="indultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a favorer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indultum: <entryFree id="n22935" type="main" key="indultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis, Cod. Th. 4, 15, 1: principis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indultus: <entryFree id="n22936" type="main" key="indultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from indulgeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22937" type="main" key="indultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>indulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n22937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">indultu clementiae tuae scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indumentum: <entryFree id="n22938" type="main" key="indu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22938.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumenta induere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: oris, <hi rend="ital">a mask</hi>, Bass. ap. Gell. <cb n="INDU" /> 5, 7.— </sense><sense id="n22938.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis indumenta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bodies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9</bibl></cit>. 99.—</sense><sense id="n22938.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumento justitiae velare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
induo: <entryFree id="n22939" type="main" key="indu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ndu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n22939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put on</hi> an article of dress or ornament (class.). </sense><sense id="n22939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculi tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi torquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zmaragdos et sardonychas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui insignia Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 598</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with a Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Androgei galeam clipeique insigne decorum Induitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et eamst (sc. vestem) indutus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: scalas, <hi rend="ital">to place a ladder on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shoulders by putting one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s head between the rounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 650</bibl>: se in aliquid, or with the <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to fall into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be entangled in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be covered with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned with;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in laqueum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum venti se in nubem induerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: cum se nux plurima silvis induet in florem, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deck itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 188</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos induerat Circe in vultus ac terga ferarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>clothed with the forms of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomis se arbos induit,</quote> <trans><tr>decks itself with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites se induunt uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis induit urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>covers</tr>, <tr>envelops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:509" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus ... tantis segetibus induebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num majore fructu vitis se induerit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 69, 5</bibl></cit> Burm.: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis sese induit arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 280</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes somnum imaginem mortis eamque quotidie induis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponit enim personam amici, cum induit judicis,</quote> <trans><tr>assumes the part of a judge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis longe alius ingenio, quam cujus simulationem induerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illorum (mortuorum regum) sibi nomina quasi personas aliquas induerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munia ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsos pavores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus ac voces dolentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditorem et hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume the part of traitor and enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume different opinions</tr>, <tr>take different sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personis fictam orationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to attribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et eloquentiam pueris induunt adhuc nascentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>impose upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:4" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua confessione induatur ac juguletur, necesse est,</quote> <trans><tr>entangle himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte, in quot se laqueos induerit, quorum ex nullo se umquam expediet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">102: se in captiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non se purgavit, sed indicavit atque induit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indupedio: <entryFree id="n22940" type="main" key="indu^pe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭpĕdĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭpĕdītus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; v. impedio, etc., and in <sense id="n22940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
induperans: <entryFree id="n22941" type="main" key="indu^pe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>; v. imperans and in <sense id="n22941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indupero: <entryFree id="n22942" type="main" key="indu^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭpĕro</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">indŭpĕrātor</orth>, etc.; v. impero, etc., and in <sense id="n22942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
induratus: <entryFree id="n22943" type="main" key="indu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from induro.</entryFree>
induresco: <entryFree id="n22944" type="main" key="indu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dūresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi> (cf. percallesco; postAug.). </sense><sense id="n22944.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vetus condyloma jam induruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22944.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles induruerat pro Vitellio,</quote> <trans><tr>had become unalterably firm in his attachment to Vitellius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pravum,</quote> <trans><tr>to become hardened in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
induro: <entryFree id="n22945" type="main" key="indu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n22945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22945.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22945.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivem Indurat Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues indurantes attritu arborum costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22945.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indurandus est animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus omnia, quae accidere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to render shameless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22945.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (creta) si induraverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 82, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indūrā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hardened.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22945.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora indurata flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22945.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">induratus praeter spem resistendo hostium timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanis quid induratius ad omnem patientiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="939" /> <cb n="INDU" /></sense></entryFree>
indus: <entryFree id="n22946" type="main" key="Indus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)indo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n22946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Indian</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans><tr>ivory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua, i. e. elephas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <trans><tr>pearls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 39</bibl></cit> (1, 8 b. 13 M.).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Indi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Indians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>; Mela, 1, 2, 3 sq.; 3, 7?*!, 3.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Indus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n22946.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22946.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22946.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An elephant</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s driver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mahout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22946.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n22946.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Ethiopian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 293</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22946.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Arabian</hi> (sing. collect.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:720" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 720</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22947" type="main" key="Indus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)indo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n22947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two rivers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22947.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Indus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that empties into the Indian Ocean</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:24 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 24 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n22947.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indusiarius: <entryFree id="n22948" type="hapax" key="indu_si^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūsĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>indusium</etym>, <sense id="n22948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of women</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s under-garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 35</bibl>; cf.: indusiarii vestiarii, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
indusiatus: <entryFree id="n22949" type="main" key="indu_si^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūsĭātus</orth> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl>, written intusiatus; cf. indusium), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has on an under-garment</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 253.</sense></entryFree>
indusio: <entryFree id="n22950" type="main" key="indu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūsĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indusium: <entryFree id="n22951" type="main" key="indu_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūsĭum</orth> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl>, written intusium), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s under - garment</hi>, Varr. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">indusium est vestimentum, quod corpori intra plurimas vestes adhaeret, quasi intusium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. indusium <foreign lang="greek">xitwni/skos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
industria: <entryFree id="n22952" type="main" key="industri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>industrius</etym>, <sense id="n22952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium industriā alitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in scribendo tantum industriae ponam,</quote> <trans><tr>spend so much pains on writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā industriā bellum apparavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <trans><tr>assiduity on the journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi numquam super industriam fortuna fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>did not surpass his assiduity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ipsus se contemnit, in eo est indoles industriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: de or ex industria, <hi rend="ital">diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduously;</hi> and hence, esp., <hi rend="ital">on purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purposely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:8" default="NO">5, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:3 al" default="NO">6, 1, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 51, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:7 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 7 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply: industriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ob industriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Rarely in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis opibus atque industriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 7, 14</bibl> (cf. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=7, p. 433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 7, p. 433</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22953" type="main" key="Industri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Industrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Liguria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the right bank of the Padus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monteù di Po</hi>, near <hi rend="ital">Chivasso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 20, § 122</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Industrĭ-ensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, Tab. Aenea ap. Maff. Mus. Ver. p. 230.</sense></entryFree>
industrie: <entryFree id="n22954" type="main" key="industri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. industrius <sense id="n22954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
industriose: <entryFree id="n22955" type="main" key="industri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. industriosus.</entryFree>
industriosus: <entryFree id="n22956" type="main" key="industri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>industria</etym>, <sense id="n22956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">industrious</hi> (postAug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl> dub.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very industriously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 1</bibl>; Suet. Vit. Juv.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Fronto ad M. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
industrius: <entryFree id="n22957" type="main" key="industri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. indo for in, and struo; lit. building within, i. e. active within; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industrious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo gnavus et industrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines vigilantes, sobrii, industrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:13:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 13, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir acer et industrius in rebus gerendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">industrios ac ignavos pax in aequo tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit aquilas armis industrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">industrior or industriior (ante-class.): quo neque industrior de juventute erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: imperator exercitum industriiorem facit, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 601</bibl> P. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">industrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industriously</hi>: rem publicam curare, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> P.: ut ea diligenter industrieque administrarent, Caes. B. <cb n="INEF" /> G. 7, 60: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri Siciliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas actitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indutiae: <entryFree id="n22958" type="main" key="indu_ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtĭae</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cĭae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for indu-itiae, from indu for in and ire, a going into rest or retirement; cf. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 17</bibl>; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cessation of hostilities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a truce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armistice</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22958.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: indutiae sunt belli feriae, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: cum triginta dierum essent cum hoste pactae indutiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutias facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire aequis condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <trans><tr>to put an end to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per indutias,</quote> <trans><tr>during the truce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 37, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22958.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cessation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immo indutiae parumper fiant, si quid vis loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 233</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">delay in paying a tax</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis indutiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the stillness of night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —Of a <hi rend="ital">truce</hi> in a lovers' quarrel: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae, suspiciones, inimicitiae, indutiae, Bellum, pax rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indutilis: <entryFree id="n22959" type="hapax" key="indu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtĭlis</orth> <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be inserted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joined in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 2</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
indutiomarus: <entryFree id="n22960" type="main" key="Indu^ti^oma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indŭtĭomărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Induciom-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n22960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the Treviri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indutor: <entryFree id="n22961" type="main" key="indu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtor</orth>, <itype>tōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wearer</hi> (late Lat.): fabularum sartor aut indutor, Aug. c. Faust. 8.</sense></entryFree>
indutorius: <entryFree id="n22962" type="hapax" key="indu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be put on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indutus: <entryFree id="n22963" type="main" key="indu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from induo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22964" type="main" key="indu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>induo</etym>, <sense id="n22964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting on</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">only indutui and indutibus in use): prius dein quae indutui, tum amictui quae sunt tangam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 27</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis, quam indutui gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: habebat indutui ad corpus tunicam interulam, App. Flor. n. 9, p. 346; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 310, 23</bibl>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">apparel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raiment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutibus imperatoriae majestatis ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
induviae: <entryFree id="n22965" type="main" key="indu^vi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭvĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garments</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudata induviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 578</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
induvium: <entryFree id="n22966" type="spur" key="indu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>false reading for inductis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
inebrae: <entryFree id="n22967" type="gloss" key="inebrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inebrae</orth>, <itype>aves</itype>, quae in auguriis aliquid fieri prohibent; et prorsus omnia inebra appellantur, quae tardant vel morantur agentem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
inebriatio: <entryFree id="n22968" type="main" key="i^ne_bri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēbrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inebrio</etym>, <sense id="n22968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inebriation</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. de Civ. Dei, 16, 1.</sense></entryFree>
inebriator: <entryFree id="n22969" type="main" key="i^ne_bri^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēbrĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inebrio</etym>, <sense id="n22969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes drunk</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inebrio: <entryFree id="n22970" type="main" key="i^ne_bri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēbrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inebriate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22970.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma vescentes inebriat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 47, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 27</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n22970.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of colors, <hi rend="ital">to saturate'</hi> amethystum inebriatur Tyrio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 139</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of plants: inebriatae radices, i. q. nimis irrigatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 247</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22970.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill full of talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inedax: <entryFree id="n22971" type="main" key="i^ne^dax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĕdax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not voracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that eats little</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inedia: <entryFree id="n22972" type="main" key="i^ne^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĕdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-edo</etym>, <sense id="n22972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abstaining from food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasting</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae oboriuntur, genua inediā succidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliis et inedia necatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inediam sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: inediā vitam finire, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to starve one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inediā mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inedias durare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineditus: <entryFree id="n22973" type="hapax" key="i^ne_di^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not made known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffabilis: <entryFree id="n22974" type="main" key="i^neffa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unutterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpronounceable</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">1: verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneffābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unutterably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineffably</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus ineffabiliter artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enchir. 89" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enchir. 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffabilitas: <entryFree id="n22975" type="main" key="i^neffa_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unutterableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineffableness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">visionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 147" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffabiliter: <entryFree id="n22976" type="main" key="i^neffa_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effābĭlĭter</orth>, adv., v. in-effabilis <sense id="n22976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ineffectus: <entryFree id="n22977" type="main" key="i^neffectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneffectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-efficio</etym>, <sense id="n22977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not</hi> <cb n="INEM" /> <hi rend="ital">carried out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. Sanc. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
inefficacia: <entryFree id="n22978" type="main" key="i^neffi^ca_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effĭcācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inefficax</etym>, <sense id="n22978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inefficacy</hi> (late Lat.): libertatis, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 94.</sense></entryFree>
inefficaciter: <entryFree id="n22979" type="main" key="i^neffi^ca_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneffĭcācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inefficax <sense id="n22979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inefficax: <entryFree id="n22980" type="main" key="i^neffi^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ineffectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inefficient</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22980.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox inefficax verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>unproductive of</tr>, <tr>unable to produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22980.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 109</bibl>: parentes inefficacissimi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very weak</hi>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 415, 10.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneffĭcācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ineffectually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:8:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:53" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffigiabilis: <entryFree id="n22981" type="main" key="i^neffi^gi^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effĭgĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-effigio</etym>, <sense id="n22981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be portrayed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delineated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffigiatus: <entryFree id="n22982" type="main" key="i^neffi^gi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effĭgĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shapeless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fetus (with informis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineffrenatus: <entryFree id="n22983" type="main" key="i^neffre_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effrēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, trop. (late Lat.): cupiditates, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
ineffugibilis: <entryFree id="n22984" type="main" key="i^neffu^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effŭgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-effugio</etym>, <sense id="n22984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unavoidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitable</hi> (post-class.): necessitas ultionis, App. de Mundo, p. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ineffusus: <entryFree id="n22985" type="spur" key="i^neffu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-effūsus</orth>, <itype>false reading for in effusum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122</bibl>.</entryFree>
inelaboratus: <entryFree id="n22986" type="main" key="i^ne_la^bo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlăbōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlabored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstudied</hi>, trop. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22986.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Obtained without labor</hi>: pabulum, Ambros. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inelegans: <entryFree id="n22987" type="main" key="i^ne_le^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlĕgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not choice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elegant; tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">orationis non inelegans copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae (with illepidae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor non inelegans,</quote> <trans><tr>a not unpleasant odor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 25, 98, § 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22987.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam inelegans esse visum est ex heredis persona incipere obligationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:100" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 100</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēlĕganter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">not choicely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tastelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere,</quote> <trans><tr>without discrimination</tr>, <tr>without judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inelegantia: <entryFree id="n22988" type="main" key="i^ne_le^ganti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlĕgantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tastelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegance;</hi> only as law t. t., <hi rend="ital">want of harmony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistency</hi> (with the general system of law; cf. Austin, Jurisprud. Lect. XXX. p. 552): inelegantia juris motus, Gai. Ins<hi rend="ital">t.</hi> 1, 84; 85.</sense></entryFree>
ineloquax: <entryFree id="n22989" type="main" key="i^ne_lo^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlŏquax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-eloquor</etym>, <sense id="n22989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unutterable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemitibus ineloquacibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Novat.</author> de Trin. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineloquens: <entryFree id="n22990" type="main" key="i^ne_lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ineloquent</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">indocti et ineloquentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineloquibilis: <entryFree id="n22991" type="main" key="i^ne_lo^qui^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlŏquĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unutterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineffable</hi>, for ineffabilis (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
