ineluctabilis: <entryFree id="n22992" type="main" key="i^ne_lucta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēluctābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which one cannot extricate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unavoidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22992.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:502" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 502</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22992.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 334</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ineluibilis: <entryFree id="n22993" type="main" key="i^ne_lu^i^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēlŭĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-eluo</etym>, <sense id="n22993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be washed out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indelible</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ira D. 23, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inemendabilis: <entryFree id="n22994" type="main" key="i^ne_menda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēmendābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be amended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorrigible</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pravitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inemendatus: <entryFree id="n22995" type="main" key="i^ne_menda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēmendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unamended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorrect</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dum de inemendatis scribuntur inemendatiora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 565</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inemensus: <entryFree id="n22996" type="gloss" key="i^ne_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmeasured</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inemeribilis: <entryFree id="n22997" type="main" key="i^ne_me^ri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēmĕrĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-emereor</etym>, <sense id="n22997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be merited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cannot be earned</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inemigrabilis: <entryFree id="n22998" type="main" key="ine_migra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inēmigrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-emigro</etym> (eccl. Lat.): immobilis et inemigrabilis Deus, <sense id="n22998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not capable of removing</hi>, (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 2, p. 128.</sense></entryFree>
inemorior: <entryFree id="n22999" type="hapax" key="ine_mo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ēmŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>tuus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n22999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to die in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> any thing (for the more usual immorior);<pb n="940" /> <cb n="INEO" />  with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inemptus: <entryFree id="n23000" type="main" key="i^nemptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-emptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inemtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpurchased</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenarrabilis: <entryFree id="n23001" type="main" key="i^ne_narra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēnarrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be related</hi> or <hi rend="ital">described</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indescribable</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mira quadam et incredibili atque inenarrabili pietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 99, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes (jecoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:177" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenarrativus: <entryFree id="n23002" type="main" key="i^ne_narra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēnarrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inenarro</etym>, <sense id="n23002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not adapted for relation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inenarratus: <entryFree id="n23003" type="main" key="i^ne_narra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēnarrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexplained</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquimus inenarratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenatabilis: <entryFree id="n23004" type="main" key="i^ne_na^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēnătābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-enato</etym>, <sense id="n23004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which one cannot swim out</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">profundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenodabilis: <entryFree id="n23005" type="main" key="i^ne_no_da_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēnōdābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-enodo</etym>, <sense id="n23005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be freed from knots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cannot be unravelled</hi> (only in the trop. signif. class.). </sense><sense id="n23005.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23005.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be explained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexplicable</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 10</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 75 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenormis: <entryFree id="n23006" type="main" key="i^ne_normis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēnormis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not irregular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not immoderate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proceritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inenuntiabilis: <entryFree id="n23007" type="main" key="i^ne_nunti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēnuntĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-enuntio</etym>, <sense id="n23007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unspeakable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineo: <entryFree id="n23008" type="main" key="i^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype> (iniri only ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Procul. 12, 7</bibl>; <sense id="n23008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> iniet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 21, 2</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n23008.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> a place (class.). </sense><sense id="n23008.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23008.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n23008.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argolicas acies non ignarus ini (i. e. inii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:107" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam, iter,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter on a journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus nullis illud initur equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:266" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hispania) prima Romanis inita provinciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23008.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23008.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13, 2</bibl>: reginam, Drusillam, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae viros ineunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of animals,</quote> <trans><tr>to pair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 178</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca ab agresti tauro inita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic velut inita arbor fecundo semine fertilior exstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23008.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi> a business, an enterprise, occupation, office, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inito magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum et difficile certamen iniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Off. 1:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cum rege Philippo initum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 1, 5</bibl>: numerum, <hi rend="ital">to go into an enumeration</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to enumerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give the number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus interfectorum haud facile iniri potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus inibatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: rationem, <hi rend="ital">to make an estimate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem inire oportet operarum, dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">initā subductāque ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: inire rationem also freq. signifies, <hi rend="ital">to calculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo, ut adjuves ineasque rationem, quemadmodum ea mulier Romam perducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ineunda ratio, et via reperiunda est, qua ad Apronii quaestum possim pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>. § 110: ut multa tam gravis depelleretur, a me inita ratio est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc interficiendum talem iniit rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make an estimate</tr>, <tr>to estimate</tr>, <tr>value</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram agrorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take the measure of</tr>, <tr>to measure</tr>, <tr>survey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: societatem cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to enter into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form an association with a person</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 3</bibl>; so of an <hi rend="ital">alliance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:3" default="NO">2, 55, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutias,</quote> <trans><tr>to conclude</tr>, <tr>make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: consilium,<cb n="INEQ" />  <hi rend="ital">to form a plan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:380" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 380</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inibat, quemadmodum a Gergovia discederet,</quote> <trans><tr>formed plans</tr>, <tr>considered</tr>, <tr>deliberated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium facinoris contra vitam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: gratiam, <hi rend="ital">to get into the good graces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtaĭn the favor of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures ineuntur gratiae, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the favor of many is gained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud regem initam gratiam volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam gratiam a bonis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: viam, <hi rend="ital">to find out a way</hi> to do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ineamus viam aliquam, qua utri utris imperent, decerni possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia, i. q. dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inită aestate,</quote> <trans><tr>in the beginning of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inită hieme,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall asleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ego paulisper pro te tua munera inibo,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter upon a course of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque adeo decus hoc aevi, te consule (puer), inibit, Pollio,</quote> <trans><tr>he will enter on this golden age during your consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 11</bibl></cit> Ladew.; cf. Forbig. ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n23008.8" n="II" level="1"> <pos>v. n.</pos> (= incipere), <hi rend="ital">to make a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ineunte aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 859</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ineunte vere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineunte aestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ineunte aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ineunte adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 1, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ineopte: <entryFree id="n23009" type="gloss" key="in eopte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in eopte</orth> <itype>eo ipso</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
inepte: <entryFree id="n23010" type="main" key="i^nepte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ineptus <sense id="n23010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ineptia: <entryFree id="n23011" type="main" key="i^nepti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ineptus</etym>, <sense id="n23011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdity</hi> (in <number>sing.</number> ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23011.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">sillinesses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fooleries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdities</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium ineptiarum haud scio an ulla sit major, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 124, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene aniles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>: hujusmodi ineptiis se immiscere, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
ineptio: <entryFree id="n23012" type="main" key="i^nepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to talk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">act absurdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play the fool</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ineptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinas ineptire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ineptiola: <entryFree id="n23013" type="main" key="i^nepti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ineptiae</etym>, <sense id="n23013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an absurdity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ineptitudo: <entryFree id="n23014" type="hapax" key="i^nepti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ineptus</etym>, for ineptia, <sense id="n23014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absurdity</hi>: homo ineptitudinis cumulatus, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 128, 15</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 61 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
ineptus: <entryFree id="n23015" type="main" key="i^neptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-aptus</etym>, <sense id="n23015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impertinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pedantic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without tact</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem enim nos ineptum vocamus, is mihi videtur ab hoc nomen habere ductum, quod non sit aptus. Idque in sermonis nostri consuetudine perlate patet. Nam qui aut tempus quid postulet, non videt, aut plura loquitur, aut se ostentat, aut eorum quibuscum est, vel dignitatis, vel commodi rationem non habet, aut denique in aliquo genere aut inconcinnus aut multus est, is ineptus esse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil insolens aut ineptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusibus advertere numen ineptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:223" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae inepto inanique impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptus et jactantior hic paulo est (i. q. nimis officiosus, negotiosus ardelio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <trans><tr>waste-paper</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictor,</quote> <trans><tr>foolish</tr>, <tr>impertinent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:175" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est multo ineptius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptissimae figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: ineptissimum est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject - clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:126" default="NO">11, 3, 126</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As an abusive epithet: quid est, inepta, quid rides?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inepte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 306</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭneptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">improperly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impertinently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineptly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdum inepte stultus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil molitur inepte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inepte et frigide uti verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fautor ( = favens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delirare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Inst. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptissime fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inequitabilis: <entryFree id="n23016" type="hapax" key="i^ne^qui^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĕquĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be ridden upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfit for riding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inequito: <entryFree id="n23017" type="main" key="i^ne^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride upon</hi> <cb n="INER" /> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> any thing (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmatae patentibus campis inequitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrenti fascino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23017.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: Aurora caelum inequitabat, <hi rend="ital">traversed the sky</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the day broke</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, p. 177 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—And in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestras matronas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23017.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina audet inequitare philosophiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to insult</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra inequitas nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 235</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inermat: <entryFree id="n23018" type="gloss" key="i^nermat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnermat</orth> <itype>armis spoliat</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110</bibl>.</entryFree>
inermis: <entryFree id="n23019" type="main" key="i^nermis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ermis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ermus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 88), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-arma</etym>, <sense id="n23019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without weapons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defenceless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23019.1" n="I" level="1"> Form inermis. </sense><sense id="n23019.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spoliatum, inermem recepisset Antonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermibus vim facere (opp. arma. tis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 22, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 60</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: manus peditum inermium, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas ex agro inermi ac nudo praesidiis agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater tendebat inermes infelix palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 595</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">674</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermia frustra bracchia tendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 175</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23019.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati,</quote> <trans><tr>without an army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 5: gingiva,</quote> <trans><tr>toothless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23019.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that wounds no one</tr>, <tr>harmless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:6:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altera philosophiae parte inermis ac nudus est,</quote> <trans><tr>unprepared</tr>, <tr>not well versed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tractanda putabat inermi justitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23019.5" n="II" level="1"> Form inermus: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paucis inermis (al. inermibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: magna multitudo sed inermorum, Lepid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inermis pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit> (in other passages of Sall. the read. is dub.; cf. Kritz, J. 113, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">Fabri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 94, 2</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
inerrabilis: <entryFree id="n23020" type="main" key="i^nerra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-errābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-erro</etym>, <sense id="n23020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unerring</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: orbis, id. de Mundo, p. 58, 6: computatio, August. Civ. Dei, 21, 8.</sense></entryFree>
inerrans: <entryFree id="n23021" type="main" key="i^nerrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-errans</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed;</hi> of the fixed stars: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae eae, quae inerrantes vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inerro: <entryFree id="n23022" type="main" key="i^nerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-erro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ramble about in</hi> a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23022.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23022.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria imaginis oculis inerrabat,</quote> <trans><tr>swam before the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi si versus noster totusve, minusve, vel bene sit notus, summo vel inerret in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:202" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 202</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. inhaereat).— Of those engaged in dancing: decoros ambitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iners: <entryFree id="n23023" type="main" key="i^ners"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭners</orth>, <itype>ertis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> inerti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl>: <sense id="n23023.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inerte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 14</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-ars</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unskilled</hi> in any art or trade, <hi rend="ital">without skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilful</hi> (class.): ut perhibetur iners, ars in quo non erit ulla, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes, quibus qui carebant, inertes a majoribus nominabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl></cit>: versus, <hi rend="ital">artless</hi> ( = sine arte et gravitate facti), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 445</bibl>.—In partic., = iners dicendi, arte dicendi carens: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non inertissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 67</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23023.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inert.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23023.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā factiosi, inertes operā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: silvicolae homines bellique inertes, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerro, iners, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicissent inprobos boni fortes inertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo inertior, ignavior proferri non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 158</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fera membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 32, § 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23023.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">inertissimum et desidiosissimum otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertissima segnitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavum et iners genus interrogationis,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>stagnant waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebae,</quote> <trans><tr>that bear nothing</tr>, <tr>without cultivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>motionless</tr>, <tr>immovable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <trans><tr>leisure hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:15:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus castigator lacrimarum atque inertium querellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 4</bibl></cit>.— Of food, <hi rend="ital">without flavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blitum iners videtur, ac sine sapore, aut acrimonia ulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 93, § 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 82</bibl></cit>: <pb n="941" /> <cb n="INEX" /> vita, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, causative, <hi rend="ital">rendering idle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 10, 19</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnerter</orth>, and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> inertissime, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 165</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inersitudo: <entryFree id="n23024" type="gloss" key="i^nersi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnersĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>iners</etym>, for inertia, <sense id="n23024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inertia: <entryFree id="n23025" type="main" key="i^nerti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnertĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of art</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23025.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): animi (spectantur), quemadmodum affecti sint, virtutibus, vitiis; <cit><quote lang="la">artibus, inertiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23025.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laziness</hi> (very freq.): inertia atque torpedo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id largiamur inertiae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigare segnitiem hominum atque inertiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <trans><tr>aversion to labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 45, 7 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">In an oxymoron: strenua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inquieta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inerticulus: <entryFree id="n23026" type="main" key="i^nerti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnertĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n23026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that produces no effect;</hi> a term applied to a sort of grape that yields a good but not intoxicating wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inerudite: <entryFree id="n23027" type="main" key="i^ne_ru^di_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnērŭdītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ineruditus.</entryFree>
ineruditio: <entryFree id="n23028" type="main" key="i^ne_ru^di_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ērŭdītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of learning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 4, 30</bibl>; cf.: ineruditio <foreign lang="greek">a)paideusi/a,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ineruditus: <entryFree id="n23029" type="main" key="i^ne_ru^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ērŭdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uninstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illiterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ergo Epicurus ineruditus, sed ii indocti, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis illud tam ineruditum absurdumque respondeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">26.— Of abstr. things: voluptates,</quote> <trans><tr>unrefined</tr>, <tr>coarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnērŭdītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unlearnedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non inerudite ad declamandum ficta materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inerumpibilis: <entryFree id="n23030" type="main" key="i^ne_rumpi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnērumpĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-erumpo</etym>, <sense id="n23030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be torn</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunica Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inescatio: <entryFree id="n23031" type="hapax" key="i^nesca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnescātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inesco</etym>, <sense id="n23031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alluring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a satiating</hi>, Aug.</sense></entryFree>
inesco: <entryFree id="n23032" type="main" key="i^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-esco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n23032.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To allure with bait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entice</hi> (syn.: prolecto, illicio; mostly post- Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23032.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut muta animalia cibo inescantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velut inescatam temeritatem ferocioris consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 41, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23032.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie parvi beneficii inescamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inescandae multitudinis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23032.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fill with food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiate</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">gravi odore sulphuris inescatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl>, p. 194, 8.</sense></entryFree>
inesus: <entryFree id="n23033" type="gloss" key="i^ne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uneaten</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ineuscheme: <entryFree id="n23034" type="main" key="ineusche_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-euschēmē</orth>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 24</bibl> (ei euscheme, Fleck., Ritschl, Wagner: sane euscheme, Brix).</entryFree>
inevectus: <entryFree id="n23035" type="main" key="i^ne_vectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-evehi</etym>, <sense id="n23035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mounted upon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quisquam ... Iret inevectus caelum super,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendit inevectus radios Hyperionis ardor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inevitabilis: <entryFree id="n23036" type="main" key="i^ne_vi_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēvītābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unavoidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sors fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnēvītābĭlĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēvītābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unavoidably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos compellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enchir. 13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enchir. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inevolutus: <entryFree id="n23037" type="hapax" key="i^ne_vo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēvŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not rolled out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unopened</hi>, of book-rolls: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inevulsibilis: <entryFree id="n23038" type="main" key="i^ne_vulsi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ēvulsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-evulsus</etym>, <sense id="n23038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be torn away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): membrum Ecclesiae, Aug. contra Don. 3, 10.</sense></entryFree>
in: <entryFree id="n23039" type="main" key="i^n8"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexamined</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 895</bibl></cit>; Firm. 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23041" type="hapax" key="i^n9"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausonia atque immobilis ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 623</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23044" type="main" key="i^n10"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not thought of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not found out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not invented</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 107</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>, where the correct read. is excogitatus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23071" type="main" key="i^n11"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsatisfied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n23071.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:518" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 518</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23071.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 439</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23071.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 667</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isai. 13, 47, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexpletus lacrimans (= inexpletum),</quote> <trans><tr>incessantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 559</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23072" type="main" key="i^n12"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be unfolded</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loosened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inextricable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi> (class. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n23072.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23072.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae continuis imbribus,</quote> <trans><tr>impassable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 33, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23072.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inexplicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o rem, inquis, difficilem et inexplicabilem! atqui explicanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>innumerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de generibus singulis disserere immensum et inexplicabile est,</quote> <trans><tr>impossible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 19, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum minitari,</quote> <trans><tr>implacable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl></cit> (al. inexpiabile).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexplĭcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inextricably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexplicably</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">implicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 255" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23073" type="main" key="i^n13"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexplained</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23076" type="main" key="i^n14"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexplored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not examined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 51, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventio mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 43</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23076.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explōrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without examining beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere, nec inexplorate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23076.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explō-rātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without previous examination</hi> (a favorite word of Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi inexplorato profectus, in insidias praecipitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 4, 4</bibl>; 27, 26, 6.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23079" type="hapax" key="i^n15"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expŭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-exputo</etym>, <sense id="n23079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incalculable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomputable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23086" type="main" key="i^n16"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exstinctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">in - ext-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unextinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unextinguishable</hi> (Ovidian). </sense><sense id="n23086.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:297" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 297</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23086.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <trans><tr>unappeasable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:428" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 6, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>imperishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <trans><tr>insatiable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:413" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 413</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexcitabilis: <entryFree id="n23040" type="hapax" key="i^nexci^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which one cannot be aroused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexcoctus: <entryFree id="n23042" type="main" key="i^nexcoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexhausted</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">glaeba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 380</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INEX" /></sense></entryFree>
inexcogitabilis: <entryFree id="n23043" type="main" key="i^nexco_gi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excōgĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-excogito</etym>, <sense id="n23043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconceivable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Inst. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexcultus: <entryFree id="n23045" type="hapax" key="i^nexcultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unadorned;</hi> with rudes villae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexcusabilis: <entryFree id="n23046" type="main" key="i^nexcu_sa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excūsābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be excused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexcusable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne te retrahas, et inexcusabilis absis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot be refused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: necessitas, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 7 al.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Vocat. Gent. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexcusatus: <entryFree id="n23047" type="main" key="i^nexcu_sa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-excūsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not excused</hi>, Ambros. de Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inexcussus: <entryFree id="n23048" type="main" key="i^nexcussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexcussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-excutio</etym>, <sense id="n23048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not terrified</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 302</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexercitatus: <entryFree id="n23049" type="main" key="i^nexerci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exercĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23049.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Untrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexercised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpractised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilful</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rudis et inexercitatus miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non hebes, neque inexercitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus et non inexercitatus ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histriones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23049.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unemployed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not busy</hi> (rare): homo, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inexercitus: <entryFree id="n23050" type="main" key="i^nexerci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exercĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unemployed</hi>, for inexercitatus (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexesus: <entryFree id="n23051" type="main" key="i^nexe_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconsumed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexhaustus: <entryFree id="n23052" type="main" key="i^nexhaustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exhaustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexhausted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">metalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>not plundered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:686" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubertas,</quote> <trans><tr>not enfeebled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; v. Madv. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
inexoptabilis: <entryFree id="n23053" type="gloss" key="i^nexopta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exoptābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not desirable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexorabilis: <entryFree id="n23054" type="main" key="i^nexo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23054.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be moved by entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexorable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23054.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, or <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n23054.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inexorabilis in ceteros esse visus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23054.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus te et rem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23054.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra improbos nocentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23054.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ni me inexorabilem faxis, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 184, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23054.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <trans><tr>inexorably severe</tr>, <tr>rigorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n23054.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be obtained by entreaty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque inexorabile certe, Quod petimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:321" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 321</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexorabilitas: <entryFree id="n23055" type="main" key="i^nexo_ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexōrābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inexorabilis</etym>, <sense id="n23055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexorability</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexoratus: <entryFree id="n23056" type="main" key="i^nexo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not entreated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not prayed for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unasked</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia praebere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexortus: <entryFree id="n23057" type="gloss" key="i^nexortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has not originated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without a beginning</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/narkton,</foreign> Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
inexpectatus: <entryFree id="n23058" type="main" key="i^nexpecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexpectātus</orth>, v. inexspectatus.</entryFree>
