inexpedibilis: <entryFree id="n23059" type="main" key="i^nexpe^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĕdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-expedio</etym>, <sense id="n23059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unavoidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">morae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexpeditus: <entryFree id="n23060" type="main" key="i^nexpe^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĕdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not free.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23060.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Entangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut pugna inexpeditior in angustiis, ita caedes atrocior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 3</bibl></cit> (al. impeditior).— </sense><sense id="n23060.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not quick</hi> at any thing (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n23060.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus obeundis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 247</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23060.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">not easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexpeditissimum est traducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 182</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexperientia: <entryFree id="n23061" type="main" key="i^nexpe^ri^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĕrĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexperience</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexperrectus: <entryFree id="n23062" type="hapax" key="i^nexperrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-experrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unawakened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopitus vinis et inexperrectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 317</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexpers: <entryFree id="n23063" type="main" key="i^nexpers"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expers</orth>, <itype>pertis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having no share in;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 920</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1391</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexpertus: <entryFree id="n23064" type="main" key="i^nexpertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untried</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n23064.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has not made</hi> <cb n="INEX" /> <hi rend="ital">trial of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperienced in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaccustomed to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lascivia inexperti advenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus bonis inexpertus atque insuetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ad contumeliam inexpertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis inexpertis cultura potentis amici: expertus metuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 86</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23064.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has not been tried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unproved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones civili bello inexpertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>new</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid inexpertum relinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:2" default="NO">4, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud tibi inexpertum curvos deprendere mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:52 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 52 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inexpiabilis: <entryFree id="n23065" type="main" key="i^nexpi^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-expio</etym>, <sense id="n23065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be atoned for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexpiable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: scelus, Auct. Har. Resp. 27.—</sense><sense id="n23065.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">implacable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreconcilable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium Romanorum in Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 4</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 2, 17, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĭābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inexpiably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irremediably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Litt. 11:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Litt. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexpiatus: <entryFree id="n23066" type="main" key="i^nexpi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not atoned for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpiated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Dioscor. 56" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Dioscor. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplacabilis: <entryFree id="n23067" type="gloss" key="i^nexpla_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explācābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">implacable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreconcilable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explacabilis, inexplacabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplanabilis: <entryFree id="n23068" type="main" key="i^nexpla_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explānābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexplicable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 329</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplanatus: <entryFree id="n23069" type="main" key="i^nexpla_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indistinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inarticulate</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">linguae esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak indistinctly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplebilis: <entryFree id="n23070" type="main" key="i^nexple_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-expleo</etym>, <sense id="n23070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23070.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexplebilis potu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 88</bibl></cit>. stomachus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populi fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23070.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir inexplebilis virtutis veraeque laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplicitus: <entryFree id="n23074" type="main" key="i^nexpli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-explĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23074.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not to be unfolded</hi> or <hi rend="ital">traced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) tractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 153</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23074.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unexplained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexplicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:510" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:48:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 48, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexplorate: <entryFree id="n23075" type="main" key="i^nexplo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexplōrātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexplōrātō</orth>, <sense id="n23075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. inexploratus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inexpugnabilis: <entryFree id="n23077" type="main" key="i^nexpugna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expugnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be taken by assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexpugnable</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n23077.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: urbes,<pb n="942" /> <cb n="INFA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23077.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in assured safety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>impenetrable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot be rooted out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus Amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:767" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitio verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas dormiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexpugnatus: <entryFree id="n23078" type="main" key="i^nexpugna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-expugnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconquered</hi> (late Lat.), in a trop. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. ad Vitric. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexsaturabilis: <entryFree id="n23080" type="main" key="i^nexsa^tu^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exsătŭrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĭnexătŭr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">appetitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexsecrabilis: <entryFree id="n23081" type="main" key="i^nexsecra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exsecrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not execrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not accursed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexsecutio: <entryFree id="n23082" type="hapax" key="i^nexse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exsĕcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pursuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inefficax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 2, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexsolubilis: <entryFree id="n23083" type="main" key="i^nexso^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exsŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-exsolvo</etym>, <sense id="n23083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indestructible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 9, 70 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inexspectatus: <entryFree id="n23084" type="main" key="i^nexspecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exspectātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inexp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23084.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis Hostis adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23084.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta vis! quam inexspectata!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:55:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil insolitum, nihil inexspectatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexquisitus: <entryFree id="n23085" type="main" key="i^nexqui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be inquired into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsearchable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): judicia Dei, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 12, 14.</sense></entryFree>
inexstinguibilis: <entryFree id="n23087" type="main" key="i^nexstingui^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exstinguĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inext-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unextinguishable</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23087.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 9, 42</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23087.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: mala consuetudo, <hi rend="ital">indelible</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inexstirpabilis: <entryFree id="n23088" type="hapax" key="i^nexstirpa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exstirpābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inext-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-exstirpo</etym>, <sense id="n23088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be rooted out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 20, 22, § 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexsuperabilis: <entryFree id="n23089" type="main" key="i^nexsu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-exsŭpĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inexup-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be crossed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passed over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insurmountable</hi> (a favorite word with Livy). </sense><sense id="n23089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 120, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexsuperabilior saltus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23089.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis fati,</quote> <trans><tr>unconquerable</tr>, <tr>invincible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <trans><tr>unsurpassable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexsuperabilibus vim afferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to overcome impossibilities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inexterminabilis: <entryFree id="n23090" type="main" key="i^nextermi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-extermĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-extermino</etym>, <sense id="n23090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be exterminated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immortal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inextricabilis: <entryFree id="n23091" type="main" key="i^nextri_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-extrīcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-extrico</etym>, <sense id="n23091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be disengaged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disentangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inextricable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23091.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">error (of the mazes of the labyrinth, from which one could not find his way out),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: cortex, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be disengaged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">separated.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>where one cannot disembark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:584" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 584</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23091.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">errores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stomachi inextricabilia vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>incurable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 86, § 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectio,</quote> <trans><tr>inexplicable</tr>, <tr>indescribable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnextrīcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inextricably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contorta fatorum licia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inextricatus: <entryFree id="n23092" type="gloss" key="i^nextri_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-extrīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undeveloped</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infabre: <entryFree id="n23093" type="main" key="infa_^bre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fā^brē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an unworkmanlike manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi> (opp. affabre; not in Cic. or Cæs.): pestem novā figurā factam, commissam infabre, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 31</bibl>, and 248, 22 (Trag. Rel. p. 93 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa, non infabre facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sculptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infabricatus: <entryFree id="n23094" type="main" key="infa^bri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-făbrĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfashioned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in late Lat. prose): robora, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 400</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23094.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confabulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infacete: <entryFree id="n23095" type="main" key="infa^ce_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infăcētē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infacetus.</entryFree>
infacetiae: <entryFree id="n23096" type="hapax" key="infa^ce_ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infăcētĭae</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [infacetus], <sense id="n23096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rude jests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarse jokes</hi> or <cb n="INFA" /> <hi rend="ital">puns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleni ruris et infacetiarum Annales Volusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infacetus: <entryFree id="n23097" type="main" key="infa^ce_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-făcētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23097.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">inficetus (homo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canius nec infacetus, et satis litteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeclum (with insipiens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 43, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23097.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">non inficetum mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 30</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infăcētē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">coarsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidly</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem haud infacete Pompeius Xerxem togatum vocare assueverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictus inficetissime Gallus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infactus: <entryFree id="n23098" type="main" key="infactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infactus</orth>, <itype>for infectus</itype>, acc. to the reading of some, in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
infacundia: <entryFree id="n23099" type="hapax" key="infa_cundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infācundĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infacundus</etym>, <sense id="n23099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of eloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infacundus: <entryFree id="n23100" type="main" key="infa_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fācundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ineloquent</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir acer, nec infacundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infacundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infaeco: <entryFree id="n23101" type="main" key="infaeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-faeco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-faex</etym>, <sense id="n23101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam concretione carnis (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
infallibiliter: <entryFree id="n23102" type="main" key="infalli^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fallĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-fallo</etym>, <sense id="n23102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infallibly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Praedest. Sanct. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Praedest. Sanct. 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infalsatus: <entryFree id="n23103" type="main" key="infalsa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-falsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falsified</hi> (late Lat.): codices, Aug. contra Faust. 13, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infamatio: <entryFree id="n23104" type="main" key="infa_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infamo</etym>, <sense id="n23104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calumny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defamation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 263, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infamia: <entryFree id="n23105" type="main" key="infa_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infāmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (infamis], <sense id="n23105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill report</hi> of a person or thing; <hi rend="ital">bad repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominia, opprobrium): hominum immortalis est infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in infamiam populo ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque indignitas rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res est mihi infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa indicia senatoria operta dedecore et infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam et infamiam ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summa infamia esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrare infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia notatur qui ab exercitu ignominiae causa dimissus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus fustium infamiam non importat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex infamia eripere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">140: de re aliqua infamiam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:30" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrogare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcire,</quote> <trans><tr>to repair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos ad infamiam alicujus edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere aliquid ad infamiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into disrepute</tr>, <tr>to give a bad name to a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cacus Aventinae timor atque infamia silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:551" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecli,</quote> <trans><tr>disgrace of the age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the disgrace of avarice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim salvis infamia nummis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad paupertatem admigrant infamiae, Gravior paupertas fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infamis: <entryFree id="n23106" type="main" key="infa_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fāmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-fama</etym>, <sense id="n23106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ill report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill spoken of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disreputable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines ceteris vitiis atque omni dedecore infames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus, infamis auctor deserendae Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captarum pecuniarum suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 45, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valens ob lucra et quaestus infamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inops infamis ne sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: domus infamis et pestilens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: digitus, <hi rend="ital">the middle finger</hi>, because used in unbecoming and scornful gestures (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 53</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 33</bibl> Gildersleeve ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis adulescentia, vita infamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes frigoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facto (maledicto) condemnatus infamis efficitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infāmĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">infamously;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui infamissime adhaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infamo: <entryFree id="n23107" type="main" key="infa_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>infamis</etym>, <sense id="n23107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into ill repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brand with infamy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defame</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n23107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tua moderatio et gravitas aliorum infamet injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12</bibl></cit>: Juppiter infamat seque suamque domum,<cb n="INFA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 28</bibl> (4, 10, 28 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc infamatum,</quote> <trans><tr>branded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamata dea,</quote> <trans><tr>ill-famed</tr>, <tr>ill-renowned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheloön,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:416" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspecti testes, quos vitae humilitas infamaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23107.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem temeritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamandae rei causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infandus: <entryFree id="n23108" type="main" key="infandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unspeakable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unutterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unheard of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res crudelis, infanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impurum atque infandum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 55, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of human flesh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 32, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 77</bibl>.— In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infanda furens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 489</bibl></cit>: jam fero infandissima, Varus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 45</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as exclamation: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus, infandum! amissis,</quote> <trans><tr>oh</tr>, <tr>woe unutterable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 251</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">infandum! sistunt amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 479</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infans: <entryFree id="n23109" type="main" key="infans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fans</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">infas</orth>, Momms. Inscr. R. N. 66; 5376; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 688, 2</bibl>), fantis (<sense id="n23109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> infantium, but infantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 14</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-for</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speechless</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">seu rubra Canicula findet Infantes statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius Croesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit Herodotus, Croesi filium, cum infans esset, locutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23109.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not capable of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not eloquent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes et insipientes homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: infantior, quam meus est mulio, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 56, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino nihil accusatore Lentulo subscriptoribusque ejus infantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut timerem, si nihil dixissem, ne infantissimus existimarer,</quote> <trans><tr>incapable of speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">historia neque nimis infans, neque perfecte diserta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23109.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not yet able to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">infantium puerorum incunabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the young of the brute creation: pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>.— Of a plant, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <trans><tr>fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 518</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23109.3" n="III" level="1"> Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infans</orth>, <itype>fantis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">com. gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23109.4" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a young</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an infant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura movet infantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mulieribus, non infantibus pepercerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sabinis incertus infans natus, masculus an femina esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:60" default="NO">9, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:168" default="NO">14, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem suam reportavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantumque animae flentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab infante,</quote> <trans><tr>from infancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab infantibus (of more than one),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23109.5" n="b" level="4"> Esp., of the <hi rend="ital">unborn child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem in utero matris Io triumphe clamasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23109.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an infant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infantine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoraque absorbent avidis infantia linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:145" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantia ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutus ut infanti vagiat ore puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>of departed infants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23109.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Childish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a child.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n23109.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Hortensiana omnia fuere infantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23109.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Speechless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not expressing itself in words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 57</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23109.10" n="IV" level="1"> For infandus, <hi rend="ital">unutterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unheard of</hi> (anteclass.): facinus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 56, 12</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 189 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
infantarius: <entryFree id="n23110" type="main" key="infanta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infans</etym>, <sense id="n23110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has to do with infants</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.). — Only <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23110.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infantārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman fond of infants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:88:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 88, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23110.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infantārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificers of infants</hi>, an epithet applied to the Christians, who were accused of offering up children, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infantia: <entryFree id="n23111" type="main" key="infanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inability to speak.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23111.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1031</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23111.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">want of eloquence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantia ejus, qui rem norit, sed eam explicare dicendo non queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilis accusatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: infantiae<pb n="943" /> <cb n="INFA" />  in dicendo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 38</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23111.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">infancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early childhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in infantia praesumptum est temporis, adulescentiae acquiritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima ab infantia,</quote> <trans><tr>from earliest infancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra infantia caelum hausit Aventini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 85</bibl></cit>.— Of animals, <hi rend="ital">the youth</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi ab infantia educati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 182</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. things: sed est sua ?*!etiam studiis infantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum cum in infantia est, dulce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23111.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Second childhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childishness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum voce trementia membra . . . madidique infantia nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 199</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23111.5" n="B" level="2"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">the young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">children</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritandae ad discendum infantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi infantiae adalligati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infanticida: <entryFree id="n23112" type="main" key="infanti^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infans-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n23112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a child-murderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an infanticide</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infanticidium: <entryFree id="n23113" type="main" key="infanti^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>infanticida</etym>, <sense id="n23113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">child-murder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infanticide</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infantilis: <entryFree id="n23114" type="main" key="infanti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infans</etym>, <sense id="n23114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to infants</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little children</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterus,</quote> <trans><tr>little</tr>, <tr>young</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 12</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infantĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a child</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jer. Hom. 1, p. 750</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infanto: <entryFree id="n23115" type="main" key="infanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infanto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feed as an infant</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infantula: <entryFree id="n23116" type="main" key="infantu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little girl</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
infantulus: <entryFree id="n23117" type="main" key="infantu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infantŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little infant</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Paneg. Const. 16, 6</bibl>; Hier.in Isai. 3, 7, 16.</sense></entryFree>
infarcio: <entryFree id="n23118" type="main" key="infarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-farcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infercio</orth>), <itype>si, sum and tum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n23118.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stuff into</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n23118.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eas partes largum salem infarcito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crumenis turpe lucrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 459</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes quos appellant formaceos, inferciuntur verius quam struuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 48, § 169</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23118.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferciens verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23118.3" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to stuff with</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">bracteas leviore materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Most. Pers. 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infarsus: <entryFree id="n23119" type="main" key="infarsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infarsus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">infersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infarcio.</entryFree>
infascinabilis: <entryFree id="n23120" type="gloss" key="infasci^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fascĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-fascino</etym>, <sense id="n23120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be bewitched</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infascinate: <entryFree id="n23121" type="gloss" key="infasci^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fascĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without being bewitched</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infastidibilis: <entryFree id="n23122" type="main" key="infasti_di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fastīdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be loathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not repulsive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infastiditus: <entryFree id="n23123" type="main" key="infasti_di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fastīdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not loathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not loathsome</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infatigabilis: <entryFree id="n23124" type="main" key="infa^ti_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fătīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indefatigable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam est virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21, 17</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fătīgābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 32" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 32</bibl></cit> ad Paul.</sense></entryFree>
infatigatus: <entryFree id="n23125" type="main" key="infa^ti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fătīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">viatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 582</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infatigo: <entryFree id="n23126" type="gloss" key="infa^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fătīgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to weary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infatuatio: <entryFree id="n23127" type="main" key="infa^tu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infătŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infatuo</etym>, <sense id="n23127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infatuation</hi> (late Lat.), Hilar. in Job, 3, p. 219.</sense></entryFree>
infatuo: <entryFree id="n23128" type="main" key="infa^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infătŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-fatuor</etym>, <sense id="n23128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a fool of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to infatuate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis, Auct. B. Afr. 16, 1: quemque adulatio infatuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23128.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make flat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infatuatum sal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infaustus: <entryFree id="n23129" type="main" key="infaustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-faustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpropitious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">infaustas exurite puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-faustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a misfortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infausto Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cb n="INFE" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infaustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunately</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infavorabilis: <entryFree id="n23130" type="main" key="infa^vo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-făvōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-făvōrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:2:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infectio: <entryFree id="n23131" type="main" key="infecti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-factus</etym>, <sense id="n23131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a non-performance</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a doing nothing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae (al. effectione),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Const. Caes. 18, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23132" type="main" key="infecti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inficio</etym>, <sense id="n23132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyeing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: purpurae, Ambros. Apol. David, 8, § 45.</sense></entryFree>
infectivus: <entryFree id="n23133" type="hapax" key="infecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to dyeing.</hi>—Only <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infectī-va</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dye-stuffs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infector: <entryFree id="n23134" type="main" key="infector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum infector moratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 25, § 59</bibl></cit>.— <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dyeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infector ille sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 3, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infectorius: <entryFree id="n23135" type="main" key="infecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for dyeing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infectōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dye-house</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bafei=on,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infectrix: <entryFree id="n23136" type="main" key="infectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectrix</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that infects</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. II. 105.</sense></entryFree>
infectus: <entryFree id="n23137" type="main" key="infectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-factus</etym>. <sense id="n23137.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unperformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cognovit, opera quae facta infectaque sient,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt facta, infecta refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et id, quod indicatum non sit, pro infecto haberi oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:27:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 27, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pro infecto sint,</quote> <trans><tr>let all be regarded as undone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta pace,</quote> <trans><tr>without having effected a peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 37, 5</bibl>: damnum infectum, <hi rend="ital">a loss which has not yet happened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but is only anticipated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in pariete communi demoliendo damni infecti (nomine) promiserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 146</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">damni infecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:15:1:section=5" default="NO">43, 15, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:31 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 4, 31 al.</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 742</bibl>, v. inficio): <cit><quote lang="la">infectis iis, quae agere destinaverat, ab urbe proficiscitur,</quote> <trans><tr>without having accomplished those things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">re infectā,</quote> <trans><tr>without accomplishing the matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta dicta re eveniant tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infectis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 5</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">infecto negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā,</quote> <trans><tr>without having gained the victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>uncoined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta dona facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to render unmade</tr>, <tr>to revoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infectum reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make void</tr>, <tr>of no effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: facta atque infecta, <hi rend="ital">things done and not done</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">true and false</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:430" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 430</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis atque infecta materies,</quote> <trans><tr>unwrought</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telasque calathosque infectaque pensa reponunt,</quote> <trans><tr>unfinished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23137.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impossible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil jam infectum Metello credens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 1</bibl></cit>;
