so, <cit><quote lang="la">mira et paene infecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n23138" type="main" key="infectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23139" type="main" key="infectus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inficio</etym>, <sense id="n23139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyeing</hi> (post-Aug.).—In <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infecunde: <entryFree id="n23140" type="main" key="infe_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infēcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infecundus.</entryFree>
infecunditas: <entryFree id="n23141" type="main" key="infe_cundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fēcundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infecundus</etym>, <sense id="n23141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitfulness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum, Col. prooem. 1, 1: terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bienni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
infecundus: <entryFree id="n23142" type="main" key="infe_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fēcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ager frugum fertilis, arbore infecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 34</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecundior materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infēcundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unfruitfully</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">meagrely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecunde atque jejune laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infelicitas: <entryFree id="n23143" type="main" key="infe_li_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fēlīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infelix</etym>, <sense id="n23143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc infelicitatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriae et infelicitates,</quote> <trans><tr>calamities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 17, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infeliciter: <entryFree id="n23144" type="main" key="infe_li_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infēlīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infelix <sense id="n23144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infelicito: <entryFree id="n23145" type="main" key="infe_li_ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infēlīcĭto</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">infēlīco</orth>, <sense id="n23145.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>infelix</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to render unhappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make wretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">di me et te infelicitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit> (Ritschl et MSS.; al. infelicent): Hercle illum infelicitent<cb n="INFE" />  di, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 99</bibl> (Ritschl; al. infelicent): ut te di omnes infelicitent, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 26</bibl> (but Com. Fragm. v. 114 Rib., infelicent).— <cit><quote lang="la">Form infelico: di illum infelicent omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infelix: <entryFree id="n23146" type="main" key="infe_lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fēlix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not fertile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus infelicem arborem eam appellat, quoniam nihil ferat, nec seratur unquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 41, § 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 45, § 108</bibl>; hence, of the <hi rend="ital">gallows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus frugibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 314</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23146.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23146.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miserable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">crux infelici et aerumnoso comparabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo miserrimus atque infelicissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 608</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi Phoenissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 627</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelicior domi quam militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23146.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing misfortune</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamitous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra fingenti Prometheo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 941</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans><tr>prophetess of ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga plebem studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:152 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 152 al.</bibl></cit>— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infēlīcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unhappily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit mihi obviam infeliciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentata res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totiens temptata arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 33</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: infelicissime, Aug. Civ. Dei, 12, 13.</sense></entryFree>
infendere: <entryFree id="n23147" type="gloss" key="infende^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infendĕre</orth> <foreign lang="greek">e)pitei=nai, e)gklhmati/sai,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
infenditor: <entryFree id="n23148" type="gloss" key="infendi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infendĭtor</orth> <foreign lang="greek">su/ndikos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
infense: <entryFree id="n23149" type="main" key="infense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infensus <sense id="n23149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infenso: <entryFree id="n23150" type="main" key="infenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>infensus</etym>, <sense id="n23150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to treat in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (Tacitean). </sense><sense id="n23150.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">V. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello Armeniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23150.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">V. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act like an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be hostilely disposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi infensantibus Dis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infensus: <entryFree id="n23151" type="main" key="infensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-fendo</etym>, <sense id="n23151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infestus): infenso atque inimico animo venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drances infensus Turno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes principibus infensae,</quote> <trans><tr>dangerous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infensioribus in se quam in illum judicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infensius servitium,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>oppressive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <trans><tr>illness</tr>, <tr>sickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 56</bibl></cit>; 4, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 36</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: infensissima virtus, Aug. cont. Jul. Pelag. 6, § 34. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hostilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis Isocrati est adversatus infensius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infense invectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infer: <entryFree id="n23152" type="main" key="infer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infer</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inferus <sense id="n23152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inferax: <entryFree id="n23153" type="main" key="infe^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fĕrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi> (late Lat.): silvae, Hier. Homil. ex Orig. 2.</sense></entryFree>
infercio: <entryFree id="n23154" type="main" key="inferci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infercĭo</orth>, v. infarcio.</entryFree>
inferi: <entryFree id="n23155" type="main" key="infe^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. inferus, I. B.</entryFree>
inferiae: <entryFree id="n23156" type="main" key="infe^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [inferi], <sense id="n23156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacrifices in honor of the dead</hi> (class.); <case>nom.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 613</bibl>; <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:454" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 454</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui inferias afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">absenti ferat inferias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 215</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:422" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:488" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferias alicui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferias his annua religione instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inferialis: <entryFree id="n23157" type="hapax" key="infe^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inferiae</etym>, <sense id="n23157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a funeral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = inferiae, <hi rend="ital">sacrifices to the dead,</hi> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inferior: <entryFree id="n23158" type="main" key="infe^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭor</orth>, v. inferus, II.</entryFree>
inferius: <entryFree id="n23159" type="main" key="infe^ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23159.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23160" type="main" key="infe^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infero</etym>, <sense id="n23160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is offered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacrificed</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>sacrificial wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">134, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infermentatus: <entryFree id="n23161" type="main" key="infermenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fermentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unleavened</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">panes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infermentum: <entryFree id="n23162" type="gloss" key="infermentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fermentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n23162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unleavened bread</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infernalis: <entryFree id="n23163" type="main" key="inferna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infernālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infernus</etym>, <sense id="n23163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the lower regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 2, 290</bibl></cit>: <pb n="944" /> <cb n="INFE" /> Juppiter, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 389</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infernas: <entryFree id="n23164" type="main" key="infernas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infernas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infernus</etym>, <sense id="n23164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the lower country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowland</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">abies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navicularii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 603</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inferne: <entryFree id="n23165" type="main" key="inferne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infernĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infernus, a, um, <sense id="n23165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infernus: <entryFree id="n23166" type="main" key="infernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infer</etym>, <sense id="n23166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which lies beneath</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n23166.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: hic sese infernis de partibus erigit Hydra, <hi rend="ital">from beneath</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114: <cit><quote lang="la">superi infernique Di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Tuscan Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 400</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23166.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Lower Regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans><tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <trans><tr>Proserpine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernas umbras carminibus elicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise the dead by magical incantations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Styx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:610" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 610</bibl></cit>: ratis, <hi rend="ital">Charon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 14</bibl> (4, 4, 14 Müll. infernas rates): rota, <hi rend="ital">Ixion</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 20</bibl>: sorores, <hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23166.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23166.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the depths of the earth</hi>: ex inferno audiri, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> 105 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n23166.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hell</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 48</bibl>, §§ 22, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 9, 18</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23166.6" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inferni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the shades below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theseus infernis, superis testatur Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:49" default="NO">2, 28, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23166.7" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inferna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n23166.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The lower parts of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abdomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 51</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23166.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The infernal regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 428" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 428</bibl>.—In eccl. Lat. = infernus, <hi rend="ital">hell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 21, 13</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infernĕ</orth>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi> (a favorite word of Lucr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 597</bibl> (opp. superne); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 764</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:187" default="NO" valid="yes">187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infero: <entryFree id="n23167" type="main" key="infe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fĕro</orth>, <itype>intŭli, illātum, inferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">throw into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place (class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or the <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n23167.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23167.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: in equum, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set upon a horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam in curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio lecticula in aciem inlatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum quinqueremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello in provinciam illato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes urbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: pedem aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed to</hi> a place, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia opima templo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas ad moenia,</quote> <trans><tr>to set against the walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferri mensam secundam jussi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be served up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply to</hi> any thing; esp. of fire, <hi rend="ital">to set fire to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectis et templis ignes inferre conati sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to set fire to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.7" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23167.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to a place for burial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis sepulcra deleat, neve alienum inferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias ejus majorum tumulis inferri jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> (a tribute or tax): <cit><quote lang="la">tributum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicesimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septingenta milia aerario inferenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23167.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi> (an account): <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum civibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes falsas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23167.11" n="4" level="3"> Milit.: signa (arma) in hostem, or hosti, <hi rend="ital">to bear the standards against the enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an attack upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversa signa in hostes inferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to wheel about and attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 27, 12</bibl>; saep. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidantibus inferunt signa Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa patriae urbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3, 13</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inferre arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem,</quote> <trans><tr>to advance</tr>, <tr>attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gradum: gradum acrius intulere Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to make war upon</tr>, <tr>to wage war against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum contra patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin a war</tr>, <tr>commence hostilities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23167.12" n="5" level="3"> Se, <hi rend="ital">to betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>, esp. with the accessory notion of haste and rapidity.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: visa vi quadam sua inferunt sese hominibus noscitanda, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer themselves</hi>, <cb n="INFE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus erat, quo se Numa sine arbitris inferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—With a play upon I. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">me inferre Veneri vovi jam jentaculum (cf. the context),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: se in periculum capitis atque in vitae discrimen, <hi rend="ital">to rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se in mediam contionem intulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 17, 5</bibl>; 24, 16, 1 al. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden' ignavum, ut se inferat!</quote> <trans><tr>how he struts! how proudly he walks!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut magnifice infert sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque etiam se ipse inferebat,</quote> <trans><tr>presented himself</tr>, <tr>came unbidden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:14 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 14 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n23167.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23167.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce; to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re severa delicatum aliquem inferre sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make mention</tr>, <tr>to mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maximum terrorem hostibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui injuriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis in socios nostros inferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen proditionis alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum castis, labem integris, infamiam bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram et impedimentum alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicui per scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiam agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: vim vitae suae, <hi rend="ital">to lay violent hands upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim et manus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera hostibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to give wounds to</tr>, <tr>to wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectari criminibus inferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem capitis in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui crimen proditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: judicium, <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima peregrinos obscena pecunia mores intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:299" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 299</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23167.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw an inference</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infersus: <entryFree id="n23168" type="main" key="infersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infersus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infercio.</entryFree>
infertilis: <entryFree id="n23169" type="gloss" key="inferti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fertĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/gonos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infertilitas: <entryFree id="n23170" type="gloss" key="inferti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fertĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitfulness</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)goni/a,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infertor: <entryFree id="n23171" type="main" key="infertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (infero), <sense id="n23171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who serves up dishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steward</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">paraqe/ths,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:109" default="NO">9, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infertus: <entryFree id="n23172" type="main" key="infertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infercio.</entryFree>
inferus: <entryFree id="n23173" type="main" key="infe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <sense id="n23173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> infer: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi super inferque vicinus permittet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. adh-aras, adh-amas, the lower, lowest; and Lat. infra</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that is below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower;</hi> opp. superus. </sense><sense id="n23173.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23173.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: inferus an superus tibi fert Deus funera, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 606</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Di Deaeque superi atque inferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ut ex tam alto dignitatis gradu ad superos videantur deos potius quam ad inferos pervenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen superum inferumque salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia supera, infera, prima, ultima, media videremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>the lower parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=474" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <trans><tr>that come out of the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 138</bibl></cit>: aqua, <hi rend="ital">that falls down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-water</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 221</bibl>: mare inferum, <hi rend="ital">the Lower</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Tuscan Sea</hi> (opp. mare superum, the Upper or Adriatic Sea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19</bibl> et saep. also without mare: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio infero,</quote> <trans><tr>upon the Tuscan Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23173.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Lower World</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> inferūm for inferorum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 2, 35), <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triceps apud inferos Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ab inferis exsistat rex Hiero,</quote> <trans><tr>were to rise from the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si salvi esse velint, Sulla sit iis ab inferis excitandus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be raised from the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferorum animas elicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inferos poenas parricidii luere,</quote> <trans><tr>in the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inferis excitare aliquem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to quote the words of one deceased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl>. <cb n="INFE" /></sense><sense id="n23173.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>ius</itype>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi> in situation or place. </sense><sense id="n23173.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: ex inferiore loco dicere, <hi rend="ital">from below</hi> (opp. ex superiore loco, from the tribunal), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">superus, II. A.: onerosa suo pondere in inferius feruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>downwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĕrĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of the lower part of the city</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 6, 3. — </sense><sense id="n23173.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23173.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subsequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latter</hi>, in time or succession: <cit><quote lang="la">erant inferiores quam illorum aetas, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>lived later</tr>, <tr>were younger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate inferiores paulo quam Iulius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 49, 182</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">inferioris aetatis esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores quinque dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the latter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n23173.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inferior</hi> in quality, rank, or number. </sense><sense id="n23173.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. specif.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatibus erant inferiores, nec pecuniis ferme superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferior fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitate, auctoritate, existimatione, gratia non inferior, quam qui umquam fuerunt amplissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum causa inferior, dicendo fieri superior posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat multo inferior navium numero Brutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl></cit>. — With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut humanos casus virtute inferiores putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23173.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure civili non inferior, quam magister fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 179</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23173.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">71: invident homines maxime paribus aut inferioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indignum est, a pari vinci aut superiore, indignius ab inferiore atque humiliore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplices inferioresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelis in inferiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inferiora secutus,</quote> <trans><tr>naught inferior</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 170</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n23173.12" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">infŭmus</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">īmus</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23173.13" n="A" level="2"> Form infimus (infumus), a, um, <hi rend="ital">lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi> (= imus; <cit><quote lang="la">but where the lowest of several objects is referred to, infimus is used,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 17</bibl>; v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 588). </sense><sense id="n23173.14" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabiliendi causa singuli ab infimo solo pedes terra exculcabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab infimis radicibus montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scripsissem haec infima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab infima ara,</quote> <trans><tr>from the lowest part of the altar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub infimo colle,</quote> <trans><tr>the foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the lowest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottom</hi>, in the phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">ab infimo,</quote> <trans><tr>from below</tr>, <tr>at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis erat leniter ab infimo acclivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 1</bibl></cit> (for which, ab imo; <cit><quote lang="la">v. below, B. 1.): stipites demissi et ab infimo revincti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:4:1" default="NO">6, 4, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad infimum,</quote> <trans><tr>at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis passus circiter CC. infimus apertus,</quote> <trans><tr>at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23173.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basest</hi> in quality or rank: <cit><quote lang="la">infima faex populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infimo loco natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summos cum infimis pari jure retinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitas natalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>the most humble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 30</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, only trop., <hi rend="ital">at the bottom</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid summe est, quid infime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23173.16" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">imus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deepest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi> ( = infimus; but when opp. to summus, to express a whole from end to end, imus is used; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 54</bibl>; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 588). </sense><sense id="n23173.17" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imis unguibus usque ad verticem summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ima sede semper haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundo in imo,</quote> <trans><tr>at the very bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 581</bibl></cit>: vox, <hi rend="ital">the deepest bass</hi> (opp. vox summa, the treble), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva,</quote> <trans><tr>that reclines at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad imam quercum,</quote> <trans><tr>at the foot of the oak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aure ima,</quote> <trans><tr>at the bottom of the ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 205</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23173.18" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most humble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequalis ad maximos imosque pervenit clementiae tuae admiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis et armorum superis imisque deorum Arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:665" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 665</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23173.19" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">īmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi> <pb n="945" /> <cb n="INFE" /> <hi rend="ital">est part.</hi> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imo ad summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus erat paulatim ab imo acclivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit> (for which, ab infimo; v. above, A. 1.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">tigna paulum ab imo praeacuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirare ab imo,</quote> <trans><tr>to fetch a deep sigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aures) instabiles imo facit,</quote> <trans><tr>at the bottom. at their roots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae perspicuae imo,</quote> <trans><tr>down to the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:588" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 588</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima summis mutare,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn the lowest into the highest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima,</quote> <trans><tr>the under world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 47</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima maris,</quote> <trans><tr>the bottom of the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima montis,</quote> <trans><tr>the foot of a mountain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23173.20" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, with respect to time or order, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nostrā intersit an ab summo an ab imo nomina dicere incipiamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid inexpertum scaenae committis ... servetur ad imum,</quote> <trans><tr>till the last</tr>, <tr>to the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormiet in lucem ... ad imum Threx erit,</quote> <trans><tr>at last</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infervefacio: <entryFree id="n23174" type="main" key="inferve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fervĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n23174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> fīo, factus, fĭēri), <hi rend="ital">to cause to boil in</hi> any thing; or simply <hi rend="ital">to cause to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infervefacito paulisper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquatum acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum infervefiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infervefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infervefio: <entryFree id="n23175" type="main" key="inferve^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infervĕfīo</orth>, <sense id="n23175.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
inferveo: <entryFree id="n23176" type="main" key="inferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fervĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil in</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seethe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facito bis aut ter inferveat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel Atticum ter infervere facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infervesco: <entryFree id="n23177" type="main" key="infervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fervesco</orth>, <itype>ferbŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be heated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabae tertia pars ut infervescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsum quod inferbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ubi inferbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne infervescat aqua sole,</quote> <trans><tr>be heated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 183</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem infervescere fronti arcet,</quote> <trans><tr>to burn on the forehead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:341" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 341</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infestatio: <entryFree id="n23178" type="main" key="infesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infesto</etym>, <sense id="n23178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disturbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubling</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infestator: <entryFree id="n23179" type="main" key="infesta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infestātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disturber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubler</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infeste: <entryFree id="n23180" type="main" key="infeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infestus <sense id="n23180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infestiviter: <entryFree id="n23181" type="main" key="infesti_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infestīvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infestivus <sense id="n23181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infestivus: <entryFree id="n23182" type="main" key="infesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-festīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subagresti ingenio et infestivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infestīvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera vertit non infestiviter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>quite elegantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infesto: <entryFree id="n23183" type="main" key="infesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>infestus</etym>, <sense id="n23183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infest</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla latus dextrum, laevum Charybdis infestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas insulas infestari beluis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari infestato latrociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera et nimius calor et nimium frigus infestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittis infestari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 2:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 59, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum minus infestat nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aloë non infestat stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons amaritudine infestatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem,</quote> <trans><tr>to impair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:18:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infestus: <entryFree id="n23184" type="main" key="infestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-festus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-festus for fenstus, from fendo; whence defendo, infensus</etym>, <sense id="n23184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infested; unquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsafe</hi> (class.; cf. infensus). </sense><sense id="n23184.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">via excursionibus barbarorum infesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infesta serpentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua tuta omnia, infesta hostium (omnia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestum agrum reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make unsafe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare infestum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>, <tr>render insecure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestam habere Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestior salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestissima pars Ciliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23184.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that renders unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that acts in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>: irrupit in Galliam, quam sibi armis animisque <cb n="INFI" /> infestam inimicamque cognovit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia huic victoriae maxime infesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens infestissima nomini Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis infesta rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestus in cognatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu infesto in agrum Sabinum profecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis signis impetum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq.: infestis signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis pilis procurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
