C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis pilis proturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infesto spiculo aliquem petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infesta tela ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis oculis conspici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infesta virtutibus tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque inimicus clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo infestissimo aliquem intueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missus morbus infesto a numine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:231" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 231</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hostilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrageously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae illi infeste in nos fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 3</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 29</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21</bibl> (with inimicissime), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infibulo: <entryFree id="n23185" type="main" key="infi_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fībŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-fiblo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-fibula</etym>, <sense id="n23185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buckle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">button together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close with a clasp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pin</hi> (rare): infibulati sacrificabant flamines propter usum aeris antiquissimum aereis fibulis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 262</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23185.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n23185.2" n="A" level="2"> Med. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulos interdum vocis, interdum valetudinis causa,</quote> <trans><tr>to infibulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23185.3" n="B" level="2"> In cookery, <hi rend="ital">to fasten together</hi> that which is larded or stuffed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7:section=372" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7, § 372</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inficete: <entryFree id="n23186" type="main" key="infi^ce_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcētē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcētus</orth>, v. infac-.</entryFree>
inficiae: <entryFree id="n23187" type="main" key="infi^ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcĭae</orth>, v. infitiae.</entryFree>
inficiens: <entryFree id="n23188" type="main" key="infi^ci^ens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23189" type="main" key="infi^ci^ens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-facio</etym>, <sense id="n23189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=78" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 78</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">apes (with inertes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inficio: <entryFree id="n23190" type="main" key="infi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-facio</etym>, <sense id="n23190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dip into</hi> any thing; hence, </sense><sense id="n23190.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tibi suaso infecisti pallulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes se Britanni vitro inficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana infecta conchylio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma infecta sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 413</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to discolor</tr>, <tr>darken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi sole infecti, nondum exusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae mulieribus infectae quotidiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis ita infecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tinguntur sole populi, jam quidem infecti,</quote> <trans><tr>darkened</tr>, <tr>tanned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus ora pallor inficit,</quote> <trans><tr>covers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo inficitur teneras ore rubente genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23190.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23190.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mix with</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>: hōc (<case>abl.</case>) amnem inficit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 418</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23190.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to taint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 481</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgoneis Alecto infecta venenis,</quote> <trans><tr>imbued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel infectum fronde,</quote> <trans><tr>that has a taste of leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 13, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23190.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23190.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia nisi alte descendit et diu sedit animum non coloravit sed infecit,</quote> <trans><tr>has merely tinged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illā (humanorum divinorumque notitiā) se non perfuderit, sed infecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 110:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 110, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestes) quarum generosi graminis ipsum Infecit natura pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 41</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23190.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23190.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To instruct in</hi> any thing (syn. imbuere): <cit><quote lang="la">jam infici debet (puer) iis artibus, quas si, dum est tener, combiberit, ad majora veniet paratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos teneros et rudes inficiunt et flectunt, ut volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23190.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infect</hi> (syn. corrumpo): <cit><quote lang="la">nos umbris, deliciis, otio . . . desidia animum infecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inficimur opinionum pravitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne hoc quod infectum est serpat longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatibus principum et vitiis infici solet tota civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: elui difficile est; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim inquinati sumus, sed infecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artibus infectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infectum eluitur scelus (= quo se infecerunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 742</bibl></cit> Forbig and Conington ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
inficior: <entryFree id="n23191" type="main" key="infi^ci^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭcĭor</orth>, v. infitior.</entryFree>
infidelis: <entryFree id="n23192" type="main" key="infi^de_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fĭdēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be relied<cb n="INFI" />  upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfaithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23192.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc sibi sument, nullam esse fidem, quae infideli data sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellovaci, qui ante erant per se infideles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non infideles arbitrae Nox et Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:50" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro, infidelior mihi ne fuas, quam ego sum tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex infidelissimis (sociis) firmissimos redderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex ad structuram infidelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infidelis recti magister est metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23192.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">unbelieving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infidel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> de Gub. 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fĭdēlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faithlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me minus putarem reprehendendum, si inutiliter aliquid senatui suaserim quam si infideliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 21, 2</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: infidelissime, Salv. contra Avar. 3.</sense></entryFree>
infidelitas: <entryFree id="n23193" type="main" key="infi^de_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭdēlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infidelis</etym>, <sense id="n23193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfaithfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infidelity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: infidelitatis suspicionem sustinere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 33</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantae infidelitates in amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infideliter: <entryFree id="n23194" type="main" key="infi^de_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭdēlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infidelis <sense id="n23194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infidibulum: <entryFree id="n23195" type="main" key="infi_di^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīdĭbŭlum</orth>, v. infundibulum.</entryFree>
infidigraphus: <entryFree id="n23196" type="main" key="infi_digra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīdigrăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hybr., infidus- <foreign lang="greek">gra/fw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n23196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">writing faithlessly</hi> (eccl. Lat.): infidelis Deo nec infidigraphus nec ingratus, (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 1, 124.</sense></entryFree>
infidus: <entryFree id="n23197" type="main" key="infi_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fīdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be trusted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos fidos amicos habuisset, quos infidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil stabile quod infidum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas Rhodiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Numidarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:578" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 557</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 254</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis infidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:48:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 48, 15</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ut segnis ad pericula, ita infida ad occasiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
infigo: <entryFree id="n23198" type="main" key="infi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23198.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium hosti in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreis hamis infixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sagitta) infigitur arbore,</quote> <trans><tr>remains fixed</tr>, <tr>sticks fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus infixum,</quote> <trans><tr>made by a thrust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infixa corpori extrahere,</quote> <trans><tr>things stuck in the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 79, § 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infixum moenibus hostem deicere,</quote> <trans><tr>standing firmly on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:173" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infixum educere telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 68, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23198.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to infix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprint</hi> (esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod in hominum sensibus atque in ipsa natura positum atque infixum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infigere animis res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:134" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio infixa animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid infixum et ingenitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint inculcanda, infigenda, repetenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infixus pectori dolor haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natis oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:738" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula dextris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:592" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 592</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:127" default="NO">8, 127</bibl>: infixum est mihi, <hi rend="ital">I have firmly resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am determined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vologesi penitus infixum erat arma Romana vitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infixum est fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:332" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:643" default="NO">10, 643</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infigurabilis: <entryFree id="n23199" type="hapax" key="infi^gu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭgūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-figura</etym>, <sense id="n23199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shapeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infimatis: <entryFree id="n23200" type="main" key="infi^ma_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmātis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infŭm-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infimus</etym>, <sense id="n23200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the lowest</hi> (in condition, rank, etc.), opp. summas: <cit><quote lang="la">ego infumatis infumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 943</bibl> P.: infimates <foreign lang="greek">u(stereu/ontes,</foreign> Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
infimitas: <entryFree id="n23201" type="main" key="infi^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humility</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 1</bibl> Music. 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
infimo: <entryFree id="n23202" type="main" key="infi^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lower</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia ad miserias infimata (opp. ad beatitudinem sublimata),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 44, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infimus: <entryFree id="n23203" type="main" key="infi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inferus, III. A.</entryFree>
infindo: <entryFree id="n23204" type="main" key="infindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-findo</orth>, <itype>fĭdi, fissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleave</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">telluri sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; so <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, sulcos, for <hi rend="ital">to plough up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make by sailing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:66" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volat cava pinus infinditque salum,</quote> <trans><tr>cuts through</tr>, <tr>sails through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:687" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 687</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infinibilis: <entryFree id="n23205" type="main" key="infi_ni_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-finio</etym>, <sense id="n23205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">endless</hi> <pb n="946" /> <cb n="INFI" /> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infinitas: <entryFree id="n23206" type="main" key="infi_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-finis</etym>, <sense id="n23206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boundlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>boundlessness</tr>, <tr>endless extent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum atque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: populi, Hilar. in Matt. 14, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ver. Relig. 43" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ver. Relig. 43</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in infinitatem omnem peregrinari (sc. animo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infinite: <entryFree id="n23207" type="main" key="infi_ni_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infinitus <sense id="n23207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infinitio: <entryFree id="n23208" type="hapax" key="infi_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infinitus</etym>, <sense id="n23208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boundlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infinity</hi>: infinitio ipsa, quam <foreign lang="greek">a)peiri/an</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infinitivus: <entryFree id="n23209" type="main" key="infi_ni_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnītīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlimited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefinite</hi>: modus, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infī-nītīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <cit><quote lang="la">in gram.,</quote> <trans><tr>the infinitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 310</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
infinitus: <entryFree id="n23210" type="main" key="infi_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not enclosed within boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlimited.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23210.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod finitum est habet extremum ... nihil igitur cum habeat extremum, infinitum sit necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër, materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: potestas, id: Agr. 2, 13, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: magnitudines infinitissimae, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arithm. 1, 4</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infī-nītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">boundless space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the infinite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex infinito coorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 367</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23210.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23210.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infinite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:94:section=220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 94, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 91</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">213: potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <trans><tr>immoderate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:61" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin cuipiam nimis infinitum videtur,</quote> <trans><tr>too prolix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 65</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an infinitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an endless amount</hi> or <hi rend="ital">number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitum auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: ad or in infinitum, <hi rend="ital">to infinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (ars statuaria) ad infinitum effloruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectio in infinitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in infinitum abeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitum quantum,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond all measure</tr>, <tr>exceedingly</tr>, <tr>extraordinarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68</bibl></cit>, n. 3, § <cit><quote lang="la">277: infinito plus or magis,</quote> <trans><tr>infinitely more</tr>, <tr>far more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO">11, 3, 172</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23210.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Innumerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo librorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum varietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum infinita multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatis exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: pecunia ex infinitis rapinis, Auct. B. Alex. 64, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n23210.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indefinite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23210.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: infinitior distributio, <hi rend="ital">where no person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time is mentioned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">implied</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conexa,</quote> <trans><tr>indefinite conclusions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in infinito,</quote> <trans><tr>to infinity</tr>, <tr>everywhere</tr>, <tr>at pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:9" default="NO">8, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23210.7" n="2" level="3"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the infinitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl> and 8: <cit><quote lang="la">articulus,</quote> <trans><tr>an indefinite pronoun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:50" default="NO">50</bibl> Müll.: vocabula, <hi rend="ital">appellative nouns</hi> (as vir, mulier), ib. § 80.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23210.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">infīnītē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23210.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Without bounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infinitely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne infinite feratur ut flumen oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concupiscere,</quote> <trans><tr>excessively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perorare,</quote> <trans><tr>without cessation</tr>, <tr>constantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23210.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Indefinitely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre de re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23210.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fīnītō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rare</orth>), <hi rend="ital">immensely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vastly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11</bibl></cit>. 3, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">magis flexa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinito praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infio: <entryFree id="n23211" type="main" key="infi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infīo</orth>, v. infit.</entryFree>
infirmatio: <entryFree id="n23212" type="main" key="infirma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmātĭo</orth>, ōnis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. infirmo</etym>, <sense id="n23212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weakening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invalidating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23212.1" n="I" level="1"> Rerum judicatarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23212.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refuting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disproving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatio est, quae ex infirmatione et confirmatione rationis nascitur controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infirme: <entryFree id="n23213" type="main" key="infirme_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infirmus <sense id="n23213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infirmis: <entryFree id="n23214" type="main" key="infirmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. infirmus <sense id="n23214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infirmitas: <entryFree id="n23215" type="main" key="infirmi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infirmus</etym>, <sense id="n23215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of strength; weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebleness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23215.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa gracilitas et infirmitas corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="INFI" /> oculorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter sexus infirmitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23215.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (sc. corporis, valetudinis), <hi rend="ital">infirmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem infirmitatis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitate correptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitate impeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23215.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23215.4" n="1" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeo contra tempestates maxima infirmitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:20:7" default="NO">20, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23215.5" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">of the weaker sex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitas a robustioribus separanda est,</quote> <trans><tr>children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23215.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23215.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>want of spirit</tr>, <tr>want of courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>weakness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: necesse est aut infirmitati aut invidiae adsignetur, Caec. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23215.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">fickleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitatem Gallorum veritus, quod sunt in consiliis capiendis mobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infirmiter: <entryFree id="n23216" type="main" key="infirmi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infirmus <sense id="n23216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infirmo: <entryFree id="n23217" type="main" key="infirmo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>infirmus</etym>. <sense id="n23217.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeeble.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23217.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl></cit>: munimenta madore, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23217.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23217.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To invalidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tam leves infirmare ac diluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 147</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 26</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23217.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make void</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter ferens aliquid a se factum infirmari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa atque omnes res superioris anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23217.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Vit. S. Mart. 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23218" type="main" key="infirmo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-firmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to establish in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">confirm in</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infirmus: <entryFree id="n23219" type="main" key="infirmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-firmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">infir-mis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23219.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus infirmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis inops et infirma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo infirmissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">infirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum admodum infirmus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sheep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen solis,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>, <tr>feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmior est panis ex polline,</quote> <trans><tr>less nourishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmissimus cibarius panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saporis vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmissimae arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas exigua et infirma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmi ad resistendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmior ad haec omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 37, § 145</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama, infirmissimum adversus viros fortes telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">neutr. pl. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infirma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the weak parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23219.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi> in mind or character, <hi rend="ital">superstitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pusillanimous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light-minded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis atque infirmi haec animi videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe minuti Semper et infirmi est animi voluptas ultio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:190" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum paulo infirmior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum concursu terrentur infirmiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines infirmissimi,</quote> <trans><tr>very uncertain</tr>, <tr>not to be depended on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">of no weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconclusive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino ad probandum utraque res infirma et nugatoria est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud omnes leve et infirmum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmiore vinculo (amicitiae) contrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23219.3" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23219.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faintly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirme animatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. — Of speech, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without vigor of expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejune et infirme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23219.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Weak-mindedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superstitiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua et fulgura paulo infirmius expavescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23219.6" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">infirmĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without energy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmiter invalideque dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 250</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infit: <entryFree id="n23220" type="main" key="infit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fit</orth>, <sense id="n23220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. def.</hi> (infĭunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 220</bibl>: infe <foreign lang="greek">a)/rcai,</foreign> Gloss.: infĭo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (<hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>), <hi rend="ital">begins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infit me percontarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: laudare <cb n="INFL" /> formam virginis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 51</bibl>. postulare plorans ejulans, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutare animum (with adoritur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigere caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita farier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 242</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23220.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23220.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">He begins to speak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his vocibus infit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 708</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 860</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ita Tullus infit: Romani, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi infit, annum se tertium et octogesimum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23220.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">he speaks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 805</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infitens: <entryFree id="n23221" type="gloss" key="infi^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infiteor, <sense id="n23221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not confess</hi>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
infiteri: <entryFree id="n23222" type="gloss" key="infi^te_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtēri</orth> <itype>non fateri</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
infitiae: <entryFree id="n23223" type="main" key="infi^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭcĭae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. infateor</etym>, <sense id="n23223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denial;</hi> only in the <case>acc.</case> in connection with ire, and very rarely without a negative, except in ante-class. Lat.: infitias ire, <hi rend="ital">to deny</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.); constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī lubet ire infitias mihi facta quae sunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille infitias ibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infitias ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without a negative: infitias eunt mercedem se belli Romanis inferendi pactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 10, 8</bibl></cit>. — With a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne infitias eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nemo it infitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque infitias eo, quasdam esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nego, neque infitias eo, nos enixe operam dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 31, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eo infitias, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 72" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:5" default="NO">19, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23223.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to defend an action at law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare debent non calumniae causa litem intendere, et non calumniae causa ad infitias ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:44:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 44, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infitialis: <entryFree id="n23224" type="main" key="infi^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infitiae</etym>, <sense id="n23224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting in denial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:32" default="NO">32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infitiatio: <entryFree id="n23225" type="main" key="infi^ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>infitior</etym>, <sense id="n23225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denial.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23225.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam infitiatione defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam negationem infitiationemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 29, 102</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23225.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a denying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disowning of a debt</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 2, 9, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscriptiones, furta, fraudes, infitiationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infitiator: <entryFree id="n23226" type="main" key="infi^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denier</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">one who denies a debt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuses to restore a deposit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille infitiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with fraudulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentus,</quote> <trans><tr>a bad debtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infitiatrix: <entryFree id="n23227" type="hapax" key="infi^ti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that denies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disowns</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 680</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infitior: <entryFree id="n23228" type="main" key="infi^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infĭtĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infĭc-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n23228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [infitiae], <hi rend="ital">not to confess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contradict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disown.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23228.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infitiatur ea, quae dudum confessa est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id posset infitiari, repente confessus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque infitiandi ratio, neque defendendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere aut infitiando aut definiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama factis infitianda tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be refuted by thy deeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro Sophocleo non infitiande Cothurno,</quote> <trans><tr>whom the tragic Muse need not disown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:30:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23228.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to deny</hi> any thing promised or received: infitiari creditum fraudare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si infitiatur, quid si omnino non debetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas,</quote> <trans><tr>to withhold the promised booty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 205</bibl></cit>: adversus infitiantem in duplum agimus, <hi rend="ital">one who denies</hi> a claim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:10" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:171" default="NO">171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infixus: <entryFree id="n23229" type="main" key="infixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infigo.</entryFree>
inflabellatus: <entryFree id="n23230" type="main" key="infla_bella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflābellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [from the obs. inflabello], <sense id="n23230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breathed into</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflabilis: <entryFree id="n23231" type="main" key="infla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inflo</etym>, <sense id="n23231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be inflated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">viscus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23231.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Puffing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:40:233" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 40, 233</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflacceo: <entryFree id="n23232" type="main" key="inflacce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flaccĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become flaccid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weak;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to become useless</hi>: inflaccebunt condiciones, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 14</bibl> dub. (Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 142</bibl> reads: sin flaccebunt).</sense></entryFree>
inflagro: <entryFree id="n23233" type="main" key="infla_gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flāgro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullo inflagrante halitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inflamen: <entryFree id="n23234" type="main" key="infla_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inflo</etym>, <sense id="n23234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a state of inflation</hi>,<pb n="947" /> <cb n="INFL" />  <hi rend="ital">puffing out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccarum inflamina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflammanter: <entryFree id="n23235" type="main" key="inflammanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflammanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inflammo <sense id="n23235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inflammatio: <entryFree id="n23236" type="main" key="inflamma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflammātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inflammo</etym>, <sense id="n23236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kindling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflagration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23236.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">portarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> in Pan. Constant. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium quodam quasi diluvio et inflammatione corripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23236.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the body, <hi rend="ital">an inflammation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos inflammatio occupat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 64, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 86, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 35, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23</bibl></cit> prooem. § 3.— </sense><sense id="n23236.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kindling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflaming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum (poëtarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflammatrix: <entryFree id="n23237" type="main" key="inflamma_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflammātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that kindles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflames</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. Julian. 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inflammo: <entryFree id="n23238" type="main" key="inflammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flammo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi> (syn. incendere). </sense><sense id="n23238.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam inflammandam relinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23238.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the body, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laser tauros inflammat naribus illitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflammari vulnera ac morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi pasti inflammantur rabie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23238.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionibus et legibus invidiam senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus animorum atque motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflammari ad cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum in improbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflammari cupiditate honorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inflam-mātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited</hi> by any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueritia inflammatus ad gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum potiendi spe inflammati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:44:296" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 44, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere et furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio inflammata manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 293</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inflammanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an inflammatory manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acriter et inflammanter facit complorationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflate: <entryFree id="n23239" type="main" key="infla_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inflo <sense id="n23239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
