inflatilis: <entryFree id="n23240" type="main" key="infla_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inflo</etym>, <sense id="n23240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for blowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Mus. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflatio: <entryFree id="n23241" type="main" key="infla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing itself up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of boiling water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23241.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the body; med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puffing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatulence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet inflationem magnam is cibus (faba),</quote> <trans><tr>produces flatulence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflationem stomachi facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala dulcia inflationes pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflationes discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 4, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflationem sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris corporibus ex cibo fit inflatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n23241.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An inflammation</hi>, i. q. inflammatio: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inflatus: <entryFree id="n23242" type="main" key="infla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from inflo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23243" type="main" key="infla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>in-flo</etym>, <sense id="n23243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blast.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23243.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae (tibiae) si inflatum non recipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:192" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo inflatu tibicinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23243.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo instinctu inflatuque divino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflecto: <entryFree id="n23244" type="main" key="inflecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flecto</orth>, <itype>exi, exum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23244.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ferrum se inflexisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>. —Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus ad urbem inflectitur,</quote> <trans><tr>bends itself</tr>, <tr>curves round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes inflexi theatrali modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum cursus sui vestigium,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23244.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23244.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi> a tone: <cit><quote lang="la">voces cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox inflexa,</quote> <trans><tr>a plaintive tone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 268</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n23244.4" n="2" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">to mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pronounce with a circumflex accent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 44</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agite, equi, facitote sonitus ungularum appareat: Cursu celeri facite inflexa sit pedum pernicitas,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>beat quick time with your feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 113</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23244.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus hic inflexit sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: jus <cb n="INFL" /> civile gratiā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26, 73</bibl>: orationem, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">style of speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudinem animi,</quote> <trans><tr>to lessen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infletus: <entryFree id="n23245" type="main" key="infle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlamented</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">animae viles, inhumata infletaque turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 372</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:651" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 651</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inflexibilis: <entryFree id="n23246" type="main" key="inflexi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flexĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23246.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dolor (cervicum), <hi rend="ital">lockjaw</hi> = opisthotonos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 52, § 192</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:6:65" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 6, 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23246.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>unchangeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflexio: <entryFree id="n23247" type="main" key="inflexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inflecto</etym>, <sense id="n23247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23247.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi helicis inflexio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra inflexio Bospori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum inflexione forti ac virili,</quote> <trans><tr>a vigorous and manly attitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23247.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modification</hi>: in adverbio temporum significationes non de ejusdem soni inflexione nascuntur, Macr. de Diff. c. 19, § 4.</sense></entryFree>
inflexuosus: <entryFree id="n23248" type="main" key="inflexu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flexŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-flecto</etym>, <sense id="n23248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not flexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without bending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflexus: <entryFree id="n23249" type="main" key="inflexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inflecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23250" type="main" key="inflexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; <sense id="n23250.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">gram. t. t.,</quote> <trans><tr>not declined</tr>, <tr>not inflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 305</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23251" type="main" key="inflexus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inflecto</etym>, <sense id="n23251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflecting</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23251.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:237" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adire inflexibus flexuosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23251.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem inflexu modulationis torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflictio: <entryFree id="n23252" type="main" key="inflicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infligo</etym>, <sense id="n23252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflicting</hi> (late Lat.): multae, Cod. Th. 9, 17, 2.</sense></entryFree>
inflictus: <entryFree id="n23253" type="main" key="inflictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infligo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23254" type="main" key="inflictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>infligo</etym>, <sense id="n23254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labiorum et dentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infligo: <entryFree id="n23255" type="main" key="infli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flīgo</orth>, <itype>ixi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (syn.: incutere, illidere). </sense><sense id="n23255.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui securim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratera viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput suum parietibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis inflicta vadis,</quote> <trans><tr>dashed against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflicta terga,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>, <tr>beaten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:281" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 281</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23255.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex verbo adversarii aliquid in ipsum infligitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is hurled at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 255</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23255.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inflict</hi> by striking: <cit><quote lang="la">mortiferam plagam infligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23255.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to inflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infligere alicui turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimenta civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit consuetudo, ut, intra certa tempora non latis usuris, graviores infligerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>laid upon</tr>, <tr>imposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pretium rei emptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inflo: <entryFree id="n23256" type="main" key="inflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to inflate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23256.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23256.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">age, jam infla buccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ore in os palumbi inflare aquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidoque inflatur carbasus Austro,</quote> <trans><tr>is swelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito quin illis Juppiter ambas Iratus buccas inflet,</quote> <trans><tr>should in a rage puff up both his cheeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflant (corpus) omnia fere legumina,</quote> <trans><tr>make flatulent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23256.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to play upon</hi> a wind instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">inflare cavas cicutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamos leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul inflavit tibicen, a perito carmen agnoscitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">cognate acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23256.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to puff up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe falsa animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis spem (with erigere animos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ad intolerabilem superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 31, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 26, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuratis solita vanitate spem ejus inflantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:3" default="NO">5, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescentem tumidis infla sermonibus utrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse erit glorià inflandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">Antipater paulo inflavit vehementius,</quote> <trans><tr>blew a little too hard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of music: <cit><quote lang="la">illi qui fecerunt modos, a quibus aliquid extenuatur, inflatur, variatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ea (medicamenta) quae ob caritatem emendi mulo inedicorum cupiditas inflaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>puffed</tr>, <tr>bepraised</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <cb n="INFO" /> <hi rend="ital">blown into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled</hi> with blowing. </sense><sense id="n23256.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibiae inflatae non referant sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:192" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina cecinit jussos inflata receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo verba inflata et quasi anhelata gravius exire,</quote> <trans><tr>with a too great expenditure of breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23256.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">swelled up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swollen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens inflato collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucca inflatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatum hesterno venas Iaccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volturnus amnis inflatus aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>, <tr>enlarged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging loose</tr>, <tr>dishevelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflata rore non Achaico turba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis inflatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23256.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23256.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus illi rebus elati et inflati non continebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatus et tumens animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflata spe atque animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia atque insolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne quisquam tanto inflatus errore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his opinionibus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:6:6:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 6, 6, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vano nuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successu tantae rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbus et inflatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus inflatusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis inflatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23256.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of style, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attici pressi et integri, Asiani inflati et inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatus et tumidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callimachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 2</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inflātē</orth>, only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid latius atque inflatius perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatius commemorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatius multo, quam res erat gesta, fama percrebuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulari inflatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infloresco: <entryFree id="n23257" type="hapax" key="inflo_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flōresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to blossom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth blossoms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristina aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
influo: <entryFree id="n23258" type="main" key="influ^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run into.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hypanis in Pontum influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem sanguis a jecore per venam illam cavam influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus qui in flumen Rhodanum influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus influit in Sequanam flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 57</bibl></cit>.— With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 24, 28, § 108</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non longe a mari, quo Rhenus influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc Lycus, huc Sagaris influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">influentes capilli,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing down</tr>, <tr>hanging loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis influens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not fluid, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">influentes in Italiam Gallorum copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">influxisse eo Scythas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">influentibus negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">influens atque effluens divinus animus tamquam influere possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: in universorum animos, <hi rend="ital">steal into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insinuate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio quam maxime in sensus eorum qui audiunt influat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animos teneros atque molles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone Graeco in proximas Asiae civitates influente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex illa lenitate ad hanc vim acerrimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis influentis dona fortunae abnuit,</quote> <trans><tr>overflowing</tr>, <tr>abounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 536" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 536</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
influus: <entryFree id="n23259" type="hapax" key="influ^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>influo</etym>, <sense id="n23259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
influxio: <entryFree id="n23260" type="main" key="influxi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">influxĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing in</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">materialis influxio in corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:192" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 192</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23260.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catarrh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nares, ad fauces, ad thoracem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
influxus: <entryFree id="n23261" type="main" key="influxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">influxus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing in</hi> (late Lat.); trop.: stellarum, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, Firm. Math. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
infodio: <entryFree id="n23262" type="main" key="info^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make by digging; to bury in the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus alte duos pedes infodiendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalentes conchas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 348</bibl></cit> corpora terrae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 205</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleas in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul ab eo loco infoderunt, in quo erat mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5</bibl></cit>: gemmas corpori (sc. auribus), <hi rend="ital">to insert in</hi>, <pb n="948" /> <cb n="INFO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: vulnera infossa penitus cerebro,</quote> <trans><tr>inflicted deeply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:534" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum perfractae cassidis aera Ossibus infodiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:238" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infossus puer,</quote> <trans><tr>buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:32" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infoecundus: <entryFree id="n23263" type="main" key="infoecundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-foecundus</orth>, v. infecundus.</entryFree>
infoederatus: <entryFree id="n23264" type="main" key="infoede^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-foedĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not leagued together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not allied</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praeser. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
informabilis: <entryFree id="n23265" type="main" key="informa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-formābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insusceptible of form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that does not assume a form</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
informatio: <entryFree id="n23266" type="main" key="informa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-formātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>informo</etym>, <sense id="n23266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23266.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an outline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sketch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first draft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium sacrarum informationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23266.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conception</hi>: anticipatio, quam appellat <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyin</foreign> Epicurus, id est anteceptam animo rei quandam informationem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius verbi imagine totius sententiae informatio,</quote> <trans><tr>an exhibition of the idea contained in a word</tr>, <tr>an explanation of its meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
informator: <entryFree id="n23267" type="main" key="informa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">informātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fashions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructor</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
informidabilis: <entryFree id="n23268" type="main" key="informi_da_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-formīdābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be feared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not formidable</hi> (late Lat.): judex, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:354" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 354</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
informidatus: <entryFree id="n23269" type="hapax" key="informi_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-formīdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not feared</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:241" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
informis: <entryFree id="n23270" type="main" key="informis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">informis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-forma</etym>, <sense id="n23270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has no form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not a proper form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shapeless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23270.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res muta aut informis fit loquens et formata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23270.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unshapely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misshapen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">informes sanguine peltae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:528" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbre cruento informis facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est illis (metallis) informius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.— Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infor-mĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hideously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horridly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
informitas: <entryFree id="n23271" type="main" key="informi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">informĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>informis</etym>, <sense id="n23271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshapeliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformity</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
informiter: <entryFree id="n23272" type="main" key="informi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">informĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. informis <sense id="n23272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
informo: <entryFree id="n23273" type="main" key="informo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give form to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23273.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:525" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 525</bibl></cit>: Martem cerā, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 331</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23273.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23273.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To form an idea of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sketch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delineate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di ita ignoti, ut eos ne conjectura quidem informare possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanium visorum una depulsio est, sive illa cogitatione informantur, sive in quiete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego in summo oratore fingendo talem informabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will describe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum (oratorem) incohandum et informandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">informat adhuc adumbratum indicium filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23273.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To inform</hi>,<hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>,<hi rend="ital">educate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">instruere, instituere): artes quibus aetas puerilis ad humanitatem informari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus a natura bene informatus,</quote> <trans><tr>formed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inforo: <entryFree id="n23274" type="hapax" key="info^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-foro</etym>, <sense id="n23274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox ausi inforare medio trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 102</bibl></cit> Jan. (Sillig, imperare); cf. also the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23275" type="hapax" key="info^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-forum</etym>, <sense id="n23275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accuse in a court of justice: Curc.</hi> Quaeso ne me incomities. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Licetne inforare, si incomitiare haud licet? <hi rend="ital">Curc.</hi> Non inforabis me quidem (with double meaning, in mal. part.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">1. inforo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 30 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
infortunatus: <entryFree id="n23276" type="main" key="infortu_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fortūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">o infortunatum senem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Eun 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me infortunatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infortunatissimus maritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infortunitas: <entryFree id="n23277" type="hapax" key="infortu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infortūnĭtas</orth>, ātis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-fortuna</etym>, <sense id="n23277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi> (with felicitas). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 5</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
infortunium: <entryFree id="n23278" type="main" key="infortu_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infortūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi> <cb n="INFR" /> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ferres infortunium,</quote> <trans><tr>thou wouldst come badly off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: ni pareat patri habiturum infortunium esse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infortunio aliquem mactare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere infortunio,</quote> <trans><tr>to guard against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cure. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus alienae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 231, 22; 10, p. 241, 35; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 11</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Dog. Plat. 2, p. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infossio: <entryFree id="n23279" type="main" key="infossi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infossĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infodio</etym>, <sense id="n23279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging in</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infossus: <entryFree id="n23280" type="main" key="infossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infodio.</entryFree>
infra: <entryFree id="n23281" type="main" key="infra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrā</orth> <etym>infer, inferă, sc. parte</etym>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <sense id="n23281.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the under side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23281.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra nihil est nisi mortale ... supra Lunam sunt aeterna omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in occipitio et infra, qua summa vertebra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius autem partes eae, quae sunt infra quam id quod devoratur, dilatantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si infra, quam rami fuere, praecidatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 123</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of the lower world: <cit><quote lang="la">non seges est infra,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no sowing down below</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of a following place in a writing, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum exemplum infra scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 9</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: inferius, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius egressus caelestia tecta cremabis. inferius terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferius, quam collo pectora subsunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:420" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 420</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23281.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23281.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, in value or esteem: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos ejus ut multum infra despectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:263" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 263</bibl></cit>: virtutem non flamma, non ruina inferius adducet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae praeterire, quam inferius exsequi tutius duximus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23281.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Farther</hi> along the coast: <cit><quote lang="la">onerariae duae ... paulo infra delatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23281.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Later</hi> in time: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quod Ciceronis temporibus paulumque infra ... geminabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n23281.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23281.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mare infra oppidum exspectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra mortuos amandare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra caelum et sidera nox cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23281.8" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">later than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus non infra superiorem Lycurgum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 40</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23281.9" n="3" level="3"> Of size, <hi rend="ital">smaller than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uri sunt magnitudine paulo infra elephantos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23281.10" n="4" level="3"> Of number, <hi rend="ital">less than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non infra novena (ova),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 6, § 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23281.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi> in rank, honor, or esteem: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego infra esse infimos omnis puto homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res humanas despicere atque infra se positas arbitrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infra se esse judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quo infra se et Caesarem videret et rempublicam,</quote> <trans><tr>he despised them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper infra aliorum aestimationes se metientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 127 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra servos cliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non infra speciem,</quote> <trans><tr>not inferior in beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferant se Marii ... infra Pallantis laudes jacebunt,</quote> <trans><tr>they will not come up to the glory of Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quidem infra grammatici officium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infractio: <entryFree id="n23282" type="main" key="infracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infringo</etym>, <sense id="n23282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking to pieces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1282</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n23282.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weakening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infractio et demissio animi,</quote> <trans><tr>despondency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infractus: <entryFree id="n23283" type="main" key="infractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from infringo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23284" type="main" key="infractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unweakened</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: infractus hoc spectaculo, Hier. Vit. Pauli.</sense></entryFree>
infraeno: <entryFree id="n23285" type="main" key="infraeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infraeno</orth>, v. infreno.</entryFree>
infraforanus: <entryFree id="n23286" type="gloss" key="infra_fo^ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrā-fŏrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forum</etym>, <sense id="n23286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the Forum</hi>: COLLEGIUM, Inscr. ap. Le-Vita AA. BB. 26, 3.</sense></entryFree>
infragilis: <entryFree id="n23287" type="main" key="infra^gi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frăgĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be broken to pieces.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23287.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 20</bibl></cit> prooem. § 2.— </sense><sense id="n23287.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be weakened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. B. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. B. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infremo: <entryFree id="n23288" type="main" key="infre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utter a noise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n23288.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to growl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infremuitque ferox, of the wild boar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 711</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23288.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to roar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum infremuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 230</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INFR" /></sense></entryFree>
infrenatio: <entryFree id="n23289" type="main" key="infre_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frēnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infraen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in freno</etym>, <sense id="n23289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taming</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrenatus: <entryFree id="n23290" type="main" key="infre_na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frēnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infraen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a bridle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites frenati et infrenati,</quote> <trans><tr>on unbridled horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44, 1</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n23291" type="main" key="infre_na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infreno.</entryFree>
infrendeo: <entryFree id="n23292" type="main" key="infrende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnash</hi> the teeth (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">dentibus infrendens gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac simul infrendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:663" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrendite, inspumate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23292.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gnash the teeth at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threaten furiously;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis infrendentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:580" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 580</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrendis: <entryFree id="n23293" type="main" key="infrendis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrendis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-frendo</etym>, <sense id="n23293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot gnash</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">infantes sine dentibus infrendes dicuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 5, 663</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrendo: <entryFree id="n23294" type="main" key="infrendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. infrendeo.</entryFree>
infrenis: <entryFree id="n23295" type="main" key="infre_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrēnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">infrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infraen-</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in - frenum</etym>, <sense id="n23295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrenis equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae infreni,</quote> <trans><tr>on unbridled horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">untamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchecked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infreno volitare cursu, Col. poët. 10, 215: lingua infrenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrenus manat de vulnere sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 43, 804</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infreno: <entryFree id="n23296" type="main" key="infre_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infraen-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put on a bridle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23296.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with a bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bridle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non stratos, non infrenatos equos habere, ib. § 4: currus,</quote> <trans><tr>to harness the horses to a chariot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrenati manipli,</quote> <trans><tr>on bridled horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 316</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23296.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (ducum) alterum sic fuisse infrenatum conscientia scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia ancoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrenat impetus et domat mundi rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivias carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 9, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrenus: <entryFree id="n23297" type="main" key="infre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. infrenis.</entryFree>
infrequens: <entryFree id="n23298" type="main" key="infre^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĕquens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frequently take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfrequent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23298.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">that is not often at a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that seldom does a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum et Romae et in praedio infrequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcus deorum cultor et infrequens,</quote> <trans><tr>unfrequent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: exercitus, <hi rend="ital">thinned</hi> by furloughs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 11, 10</bibl>: miles, <hi rend="ital">that does not appear regularly at his standard</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 5</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Hence: pro infrequente eum mittat militia domum (meretrix), of a lover,</quote> <trans><tr>who makes few presents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23298.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that does not often happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is seldom used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Appius senatum infrequentem coëgisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae copiae ipsae hoc infrequentiores imponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:31:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrequentissima urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the parts least inhabited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans><tr>which is attended by few hearers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23298.3" n="B" level="2"> Usually with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not filled with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not well provided with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not acquainted with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">altera pars (urbis) infrequens aedificiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa infrequentia armatis,</quote> <trans><tr>to which but few soldiers belong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrequentia signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris te reddidisti infrequentem,</quote> <trans><tr>inexperienced</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">with little knowledge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilled in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum Latinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infrĕquenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rarely</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infrequentatus: <entryFree id="n23299" type="main" key="infre^quenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĕquentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not much used</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrequentia: <entryFree id="n23300" type="main" key="infre^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n23300.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thinness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanliness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodita (sc. legionum),</quote> <trans><tr>the small number of his troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23300.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Solitariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loneliness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrico: <entryFree id="n23301" type="main" key="infri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĭco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, and cātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem ex aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal infricatus juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscae infricatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 12, 34, § 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infricolo: <entryFree id="n23302" type="main" key="infri^co^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrĭcŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>infrico</etym>, <sense id="n23302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="949" /> <cb n="INFR" /> <hi rend="ital">rub in repeatedly</hi> (late Lat.): oculum infricolato, Pelag. Veter. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
